Rogers)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/6154d5a42fb46b0019beab71?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn71@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-244_74b26f902bbd9c13.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155da587b09e80018e58b80?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn28@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-31-203_910c6561e49a73b1.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155eb97b414c10018631e58?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn76@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-31-612_9dc6e2e48e0a00d6.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155c7fdb414c100186310b5?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn79@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-35-354_3aa8729842cb743a.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155c1ba7b09e80018e584cd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn31@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-31-239_409e052a2b6fe539.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155da0bb414c1001863171e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn83@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-35-169_da2251324afe773f.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155dbafb414c100186317d2?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn39@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-35-797_48b89c8e59101e62.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155e458b414c10018631b91?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn19@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-33-377_e5ad05b5a843c825.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155dbf67b09e80018e58c21?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn36@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-35-352_aea0d7d9a265a60c.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155e830b414c10018631d23?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn51@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-44-083_8b2a43caab0390d4.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155e614b414c10018631c44?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn83@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-33-898_b5a6468e2347b540.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155f7757b09e80018e59607?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn35@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-34-121_31b4598b67739339.webp","https://i.insider.com/6155debab414c100186318fa?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn71@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-35-471_82d9a94585a66732.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Wvq5hFp-ZxI:jXLMJSWsl-E:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn27@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-31-550_6ba1e509720e6490.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Wvq5hFp-ZxI:jXLMJSWsl-E:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn95@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-33-386_48fa96e582637fe8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Wvq5hFp-ZxI:jXLMJSWsl-E:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn19@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-36-227_58e3ac9cdf036593.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Wvq5hFp-ZxI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-35-801_e0b9e43f1eaaf7a3.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085579},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"Top marketers from Chipotle, Walmart, and others lay out how they're using mobility data to tailor consumer experiences","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/arity-executive-roundtable-recap-how-mobility-data-transforms-consumer-experiences-2021-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60958ddff22c6b00185dd076?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Chipotle drive-thru\" height=\"2793\" width=\"3724\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Mary Meisenzahl/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Mobility data can help brands fill in the blanks when it comes to measuring campaign performances. </li>\n<li>Top marketers joined Insider and Arity for a roundtable discussion this week.</li>\n<li>They discussed how mobility data can transform future consumer experiences.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">This conversation was part of Insider&#39;s virtual event &#34;How Mobility Data Transforms Future Consumer Experiences,&#34; presented by Arity, on Tuesday, September 28.</li>\n</ul><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pg-nfl-using-games-and-quizzes-gather-first-party-data-2021-2\">Data</a> has become an integral component in most <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pg-has-saved-over-1-billion-by-overhauling-how-it-works-with-agencies-2019-4\">marketers&#39;</a> toolkits in recent years. And with people in some parts of the world back on the move, marketers are once again thinking about the applications of mobility data in their ad campaigns.</p><p>Top marketers from companies including Chipotle, Walmart, Turo, and ad agency Essence joined Insider for a virtual roundtable event, &#34;The Future of Mobility: Data Driving Innovation,&#34; presented by Arity, on Tuesday, September 28. They discussed how mobility data can transform future consumer experiences.</p><p>They discussed how to use mobility data to make ad campaigns more useful for people, how to sift through the data to find the most relevant nuggets, and how to best measure the success of mobility ads.</p><h2><strong>Mobility data can help make ads more useful for consumers</strong></h2><p>The ubiquity of mobile phones can unlock new insights for marketers when it comes to targeting potential customers. </p><p>But people can get annoyed - or worse, spooked - if the ads they&#39;re served aren&#39;t relevant, Saleel Sathe, Walmart&#39;s VP of performance marketing, said.</p><p>When Uber pushes an <a href=\"https://www.ubereats.com/\">UberEats</a> discount code on someone&#39;s Uber app while they are on their way back home from the airport, or Walmart Plus alerts members to discounts when they are in the vicinity of a store, they are using mobility data in the right context, he said.</p><p>Jason Harrison, North America CEO of Essence, agreed that there&#39;s a fine line between being useful and being creepy.</p><h2><strong>Loyalty programs and mobility data can go hand-in-hand</strong></h2><p>Brands have <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/pg-nfl-using-games-and-quizzes-gather-first-party-data-2021-2\">accelerated their first-party data-collection efforts</a> as privacy regulation gains steam and platforms clamp down on ad targeting. One way of doing that is through loyalty programs, which can enhance their ads when coupled with mobility data, Chris Brand, chief marketing officer at Chipotle, said.</p><p>Chipotle, for example, makes sure that it offers people something valuable whenever it uses mobility data, like informing its app users that might be coming into a restaurant that mobile pickup might be faster, he said.</p><p>Relevant offers are key to engagement, he added.</p><p>And doing this right can also lead to better returns in the long run. Chipotle&#39;s loyalty program has helped the restaurant chain swiftly grow its digital sales, which have now surpassed $2 billion. Chipotle has been able to drive more incremental transactions from loyalty members compared to non-loyalty members, he said.</p><h2><strong>Testing and targeting using mobility data</strong></h2><p>The precision that mobility data offers in terms of targeting may be enticing, but it&#39;s important to not get carried away and test different creative with different audiences, Kelly McGee, director of digital marketing at Jersey Mike&#39;s Subs, said. </p><p>Marketers shouldn&#39;t shy away from testing out smaller <a href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/m/micromarketing.asp#:~:text=Micromarketing%20is%20an%20advertising%20strategy,geared%20toward%20that%20specific%20group.\">micro-campaigns</a> and seeing what sticks, Fred Bucher, CMO of the Weather Channel, said .</p><p>But Chipotle&#39;s Brandt warned against the temptation to get too targeted, saying that the audience segments should remain broad. He added that marketers&#39; emphasis on one-to-one marketing had gotten a little extreme.</p><h2><strong>Mobility data can help measure campaign effectiveness</strong></h2><p>Mobility data can help brands fill in the blanks when it comes to how ad campaigns drive foot traffic to stores,  Walmart&#39;s Sathe pointed out. But mobility data can drive not just performance, but also help build the brand, he said.</p><p>Even if there&#39;s no immediate transaction, those visitors may purchase in the future, he said. And that sort of incremental value is not easy to measure.</p><p>Essence&#39;s Harrison agreed, saying that brands should avoid an over-focus on <a href=\"https://seodigitalgroup.com/what-is-a-conversion/\">conversions</a>, and exclude people that have a high likelihood to convert anyway when measuring mobility data.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/arity-executive-roundtable-recap-how-mobility-data-transforms-consumer-experiences-2021-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Z_jUlFxwW6I:K8Xrk513ctc:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=Z_jUlFxwW6I:K8Xrk513ctc:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z_jUlFxwW6I:K8Xrk513ctc:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Z_jUlFxwW6I\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Sep 2021 20:34:32 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/60958ddff22c6b00185dd076?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5a133dca556e0f114fa9bed30b635fb9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-22-450_62a65cb80d3e3084.webp","destWidth":3724,"destHeight":2793,"sourceBytes":702442,"destBytes":702442,"author":"tdua@businessinsider.com (Tanya Dua)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/60958ddff22c6b00185dd076?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn47@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-22-450_62a65cb80d3e3084.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z_jUlFxwW6I:K8Xrk513ctc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn100@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-33-648_527539b8ff4c7f41.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z_jUlFxwW6I:K8Xrk513ctc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn8@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-30-848_426a3202a75dd8c3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=Z_jUlFxwW6I:K8Xrk513ctc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn19@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-758_8b867d04d5747d92.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/Z_jUlFxwW6I":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn16@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-30-802_352ca3741be87af5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085601},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"Festivus arrives early this year - you can stream every 'Seinfeld' episode on Netflix starting October 1","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/where-to-watch-seinfeld","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, Insider may earn an affiliate commission. <a in &#34;Seinfeld.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">NBCUniversal</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>&#34;Seinfeld&#34; will be available to stream on <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Netflix</a> starting October 1.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\">You can watch all 180 episodes of the adored sitcom in up to 4K quality.</li>\n<li>Monthly subscriptions to <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Netflix</a> start at $9, but to get 4K quality you need the $18 a month plan.</li>\n</ul><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5dc447ee7eece57c05636587\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Gift Card (small)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5e1f78fb24306a1454254329\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Monthly Subscription (small)</bi-shortcode><p>Every episode of &#34;Seinfeld&#34; will be available to watch on <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Netflix</a> on October 1. Created by Larry David and Jerry Seinfeld, the series originally aired from 1989 to 1998, and won the Emmy award for best comedy in 1993.</p><p>&#34;Seinfeld&#34; stars Jason Alexander, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Michael Richards, and Jerry Seinfeld as a group of flawed friends living in New York City. From being denied soup to getting lost in a parking garage, the gang finds themselves in one awkward situation after another - all while learning as little as possible along the way.</p><iframe width=\"640\" height=\"360\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/u_bArdgpin0\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"\"></iframe><p>When &#34;Seinfeld&#34; arrives on <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix</a>, viewers can experience the celebrated series like never before. Netflix&#39;s Chief Content Officer Ted Sarandos told the <a href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/business/story/2019-09-16/netflix-acquires-the-global-streaming-rights-to-seinfeld\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Los Angeles Times</a> that &#34;Seinfeld&#34; will be available to stream for the first time with 4K quality resolution.</p><h2><strong>Where to watch &#39;Seinfeld&#39;</strong></h2><p>You can watch all 180 episodes of &#34;Seinfeld&#34; on <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix</a> starting October 1. If you don&#39;t already have a subscription to the streaming service, Netflix offers three core plans ranging in price from $9 to $18 a month.</p><p>The basic plan costs $9 a month and gives you access to <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix&#39;s entire catalog</a> of TV shows, movies, and original entertainment. With the basic plan, you can stream in standard definition (SD) on just one device at a time.</p><p>Viewers who want to stream simultaneously on two devices and in high definition (HD) should check out <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix&#39;s standard plan</a> for $14 a month. For $18 a month, <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix&#39;s premium plan</a> supports up to 4K HDR streaming on four devices at the same time.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5dc447ee7eece57c05636587\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Gift Card (small)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5e1f78fb24306a1454254329\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Monthly Subscription (small)</bi-shortcode><p>As a streaming service, <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix</a> stands out for its expansive catalog. Whether you want to watch original series like &#34;Stranger Things,&#34; network TV shows like &#34;Grey&#39;s Anatomy,&#34; or critically acclaimed movies like &#34;The Irishman,&#34; Netflix has one of the most well-rounded catalogs on the market.</p><h2><strong>Is &#39;Seinfeld&#39; streaming on Hulu?</strong></h2><p>Although Hulu was the previous streaming home for all nine seasons of &#34;Seinfeld,&#34; the show is no longer available to watch on that service. &#34;Seinfeld&#34; left the Hulu catalog on June 23. The show is now exclusive to Netflix.</p><h2><strong>What other sitcoms can I watch on Netflix?</strong></h2><p>In addition to &#34;Seinfeld,&#34; <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix</a> has a bunch of other sitcoms you can stream, including other popular NBC shows like &#34;Community&#34; and &#34;30 Rock.&#34; </p><p>Here&#39;s a selection of some other hit sitcoms currently available to stream on <a href=\"https://www.netflix.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Netflix</a>:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;Arrested Development&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;Grace and Frankie&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;Happy Endings&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;Lady Dynamite&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;New Girl&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;One Day at a Time&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;The Good Place&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;The IT Crowd&#34;</li><li aria-level=\"1\">&#34;Schitt&#39;s Creek&#34;</li></ul><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=g_GpwIgEHEs:NtOCTZtD84g:F7zBnMyn0Lo\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=g_GpwIgEHEs:NtOCTZtD84g:F7zBnMyn0Lo\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/g_GpwIgEHEs\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Sep 2021 20:14:44 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/5d823a7e2e22af6dc42dee18?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"e8375e90ba6d20fdddf0d27fee7a098e","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn8@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-29-876_61fd62c963757c1c.webp","destWidth":1156,"destHeight":867,"sourceBytes":22738,"destBytes":22738,"author":"insider@insider.com (Reece Rogers)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d2ce27ab44ce7429e74fb8f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn4@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-30-518_4a39bf599814a9b0.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=g_GpwIgEHEs:NtOCTZtD84g:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn35@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-32-067_8639c954cdadf02d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=g_GpwIgEHEs:NtOCTZtD84g:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn7@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-33-082_f60665ac2a575329.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=g_GpwIgEHEs:NtOCTZtD84g:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn92@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-36-308_baaa9ae630833d9a.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/g_GpwIgEHEs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn24@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-35-394_83db6ac73d86a3df.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085859},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"Gov. Gavin Newsom signs bill into law allowing for sweeping law enforcement reform in California","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/california-bill-could-mean-the-end-of-qualified-immunity-2021-8","description":"<p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/612d3b639ef1e50018f8cfe6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GARDENA, CALIFORNIA JUNE 20, 2020-A man can&#39;t hold back his emotions during a Black Lives Matter Los Angeles rally to call for justice in the fatal shooting of KennethRoss Jr., who was shot by a Gardena police officer in 2018.\" height=\"2015\" width=\"3583\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A man can&#39;t hold back his emotions during a Black Lives Matter Los Angeles rally to call for justice in the fatal shooting of Kenneth Ross Jr., who was shot by a Gardena police officer in 2018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Wally Skalij/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>California was one of four states without a police decertification process for officers charged with misconduct.</li>\n<li>The law adjusts qualified immunity for law enforcement.</li>\n<li>California Gov. Gavin Newsom signed the bill on Thursday, September 30.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Gov. Gavin Newsom signed a bill into law on Thursday that aims to increase the accountability of law enforcement in the state of California.</p><p>&#34;I am here as governor mindful that we are in the juxtaposition of being a leader on police reform, and being a laggard on police reform,&#34; said Newsom during a ceremony where he signed the bill. </p><p>Newsom had until October 10 to sign or veto the bill, which passed the final concurrence vote in Senate on Wednesday (28-9). It was previously passed in the state Senate on May 26 with a vote of 26 to 9 and the state Assembly with a vote of 46 to 18 on September 3.</p><p>The law adjusts qualified immunity - the defense that protects state and local government officials, including law enforcement, from individual liability unless there is a clear violation of constitutional rights - for law enforcement.</p><p>It will set up a process by which law enforcement officers charged with wrongdoing - including sexual assault, excessive use of force, and perjury - are stripped of their badges.</p><p>Newsom also signed Assembly Bill 89, raising the legal age for police officers from 18-years-old to 21-years-old.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#34;This is a major victory for advocates of public safety,&#34; said Senator Bradford in <a href=\"https://sd35.senate.ca.gov/news/2021-09-08-sb-2-kenneth-ross-jr-police-decertification-act-2021-approved-legislature\">a press release</a>. &#34;California and the nation as a whole has experienced tragedy after tragedy where consequences for egregious abuses of power went unpunished and cries for accountability went unanswered- eroding public trust in law enforcement.&#34;</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#34;This bill is about coming together to root out and remove systemic racism that lurks within our institutions, preventing more violence against people of color, and increasing safety and equality for all who call California home - that work continues,&#34; said Senate President pro Tempore Toni G. Atkins in the same statement. &#34;Our work will not end with this bill&#39;s passage - and we won&#39;t rest until the system changes.&#34; </p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The bill, which failed in the California legislature last year, reemerged as a result of the George Floyd protests.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">California was one of only four states - Hawaii, New Jersey, and Rhode Island are the others - without a decertification process for police officers which meant officers that engage in misconduct could still get jobs in different departments.</p><div class=\"insider-raw-embed\"><biembeddedobject id=\"01c06da5-792d-48ea-bc72-c2fbbd9f31bb\" class=\"raw mceNonEditable\"> </biembeddedobject></div><p> </p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The California bill, co-authored by state Sen. Toni Atkins, is similar to the decertification process in Massachusetts, which just <a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/nicksibilla/2021/01/09/new-massachusetts-law-will-decertify-rogue-cops-revoke-their-immunity/?sh=401fca2b5297\">became law in January 2021</a>.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#34;California is able to revoke the certification or licenses of bad doctors, lawyers, and even barbers and cosmetologists, but is unable to decertify police officers who have broken the law and violated the public trust,&#34; said Sen. Steven Bradford, also a co-author of the bill, pointed out to Insider in August.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Officers accused of misconduct would undergo a fair review process, per the bill, and those convicted of a crime would be registered into the National Decertification Index. This would prohibit them from working in law enforcement in states that have a decertification process. </p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">For Bradford, who represents Gardena, California, the implications of the law hit close to home. <a href=\"https://leginfo.legislature.ca.gov/faces/billTextClient.xhtml?bill_id=202120220SB2\">California Senate Bill 2</a>, or Kenneth Ross Jr. Decertification Act, is named after a 25-year-old Black man who was killed by Gardena Police Officer Michael Robbins on April 11, 2018.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#34;No mother should have to live with the kind of pain that I live with every day. This Act gives us the ability to decertify cops who kill and abuse our people. With this Act, my son&#39;s spirit lives on and protects our communities from police who bring harm,&#34; Fouzia Almarou, Ross Jr.&#39;s mother, said in a written statement.</p><h2 style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>The killing of Kenneth Ross Jr.</strong></h2><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Police received calls on a Wednesday afternoon in 2018 about a shooting in front of a building on Van Ness Ave. in Gardena, according to a report from then-<a href=\"https://da.lacounty.gov/sites/default/files/pdf/JSID-OIS-05-2019-Ross.pdf\">District Attorney Jackie Lacey</a>. One caller estimated that 20 shots were fired. According to the report, the suspect was described as a Black man with locs near El Segundo Blvd and Van Ness Ave.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Several officers responded, including Sergeant Michael Robbins. Ross Jr. was running away when officers shouted commands at him. Robbins, using a department-issued AR-15 rifle, fired two shots as Ross Jr. was running away.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Video footage from officer body cameras and dash cameras was released nearly two years later. His mother describes the video of the incident at multiple rallies. She said that after Robbins shot and killed him, they still handcuffed and searched his body.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Gardena Police Department said in a <a href=\"http://www.gardenapd.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Statement-on-Kenneth-Ross-Shooting-Dec-2018-FINAL.pdf\">press release</a> that a gun was found on the scene and that he&#39;d fired a gun earlier.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Ross family attorney disputes this claim, however. &#34;They said he had a gun. We have the video of when he fell,&#34; Haytham Faraj told <a href=\"https://abc7.com/kenneth-ross-jr-gardena-police-shooting-ois-michael-robbins/5872326/\">local news station KABC</a>. &#34;They then handcuff him to search him. They do search him. They find nothing.&#34; </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-JoJo.  (@iamjojo) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1266863064772571136?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">May 30, 2020</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Gardena Police Department did not respond to Insider&#39;s request for comment.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Robbins was later absolved of all wrongdoing by the Los Angeles County District Attorney&#39;s Office in 2019 - then Lacey&#39;s office. The District Attorney&#39;s office said in a press release at the time, &#34;It is our conclusion that Officer Robbins acted in self-defense and in an effort to arrest a dangerous fleeing felon.&#34;</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">State Sen. Bradford told <a href=\"https://www.capradio.org/articles/2021/03/18/california-lawmakers-push-bill-to-decertify-police-end-qualified-immunity/\">CapRadio</a> that Robbins had been involved in previous shootings as an officer in Orange County before joining the department in Gardena - a claim that local activists told Insider when pointing to their support of this bill.</p><h2>Los Angeles activists and organizers have been demanding justice</h2><p>Sheila Bates, an organizer with the Los Angeles chapter of Black Lives Matter, told Insider that this is the second year of bringing the bill back &#34;in the names of all of those who we have lost.&#34;</p><h2><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/612d355012b9cc0019636767?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GARDENA, CALIFORNIA JUNE 20, 2020-Pastor James Thomas, right, is hugged after a speach at a Black Lives Matter Los Angeles rally to call for justice in the fatal shooting of KennethRoss Jr., who was shot by a Gardena police officer in 2018.\" height=\"2602\" width=\"3470\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Pastor James Thomas, right, is hugged after a speech at a Black Lives Matter Los Angeles rally to call for justice in the fatal shooting of Kenneth Ross Jr., who was shot by a Gardena police officer in2 018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Wally Skalij/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></h2><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Latinos, who make up 39% of the California population, account for 46% of police killings in the state, while the percentage of police killings (15.2%) is more than double the state population of Black people (6.5%), according to Calmatters, a nonprofit newsroom.</p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Erika Ishii  (@erikaishii) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1274535170440220673?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">June 21, 2020</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><a href=\"https://calmatters.org/explainers/california-police-shootings-deadly-force-new-law-explained/\">Calmatters</a> estimates that between 100 and 200 people die at the hands of law enforcement in California each year. <a href=\"https://ktla.com/news/local-news/885-people-have-been-killed-by-police-in-l-a-county-since-2000-most-were-black-or-latino/\">Local news station KTLA</a> estimates that 885 people have been killed by police in Los Angeles County alone since 2000 - most of whom were Black or Latino. <a href=\"https://homicide.latimes.com/officer_involved/true/year/2021\">The Los Angeles Times Homicide Report</a> - a free tool that tracks, categorizes, and details the deaths of victims - estimates that 22 people have been killed by law enforcement so far in 2021 in Los Angeles County alone.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Albert Corado, a co-founder of People&#39;s City Council-LA and a candidate for LA City Council District 13, told Insider that he became an abolitionist when his sister, <a href=\"https://laist.com/news/mely-corado-trader-joes-two-year-anniversary-silver-lake-shootout-lapd-police\">Mely Corado, was killed by LAPD</a> while doing her job at Trader Joe&#39;s in Silver Lake - a neighborhood in Los Angeles.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#34;And so, as it stands, because cops have qualified immunity, they can do something, kill someone and then basically move on and go to another department, and move to another city and be hired as a police officer,&#34; Corado told Insider.</p><h2 style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>The law aims to hold officers accountable for misconduct</strong></h2><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"> The Kenneth Ross Jr. Decertification Act aims to strengthen the accountability of law enforcement.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">A decertification process would prevent law enforcement who have been convicted of misconduct - ranging from excessive force and sexual assault to dishonesty and falsifying evidence - to continue their career in law enforcement.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The Peace Officer Standards Accountability Division, under the Commission on Peace Officer Standards and Training (POST), would look into &#34;serious misconduct that may provide grounds for suspension or revocation of a peace officer&#39;s certification.&#34; An advisory board would then make the recommendation about the officer&#39;s certification to POST. POST would then act accordingly.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Two now-former Torrance police officers, who were relieved of their positions last year, were <a href=\"https://abc7.com/torrance-police-vandalism-swastika/10964384/\">charged with conspiracy and vandalism</a> on Thursday, August 19, for an incident that involved a spray-painted swastika on the inside of an impounded vehicle.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">Bradford told Insider that, without a decertification process, these officers could be hired on to a new department and &#34;continue their racist and hateful misconduct.&#34;</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/612d3f7712b9cc0019636b5e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"GARDENA, CALIFORNIA JUNE 20, 2020-People stand in unity at a Black Lives Matter Los Angeles rally to call for justice in the fatal shooting of KennethRoss Jr., who was shot by a Gardena police officer in2018.\" height=\"2646\" width=\"3528\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>People stand in unity at a Black Lives Matter Los Angeles rally to call for justice in the fatal shooting of Kenneth Ross Jr., who was shot by a Gardena police officer in2 018.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Wally Skalij/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#34;It&#39;s incredibly important that the bill gets passed so that we can finally be able to make sure that officers who engage in misconduct aren&#39;t able to go to another community in another department and terrorize and kill people in another department and another, in another community from their department,&#34; Bates told Insider.</p><h2 style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><strong>What opponents of the bill say</strong></h2><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/612d408512b9cc0019636bbf?format=jpeg\" alt=\"LOS ANGELES, CALIFORNIA - AUGUST 03: Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) officers walk with community members during a National Night Out event hosted by Melrose Action on August 03, 2021 in Los Angeles, California. LAPD officers lead a one mile `Light The Night Safety Walk&#39; at the event which promoted police-community relationships.\" height=\"2718\" width=\"3625\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) officers walk with community members during a National Night Out event hosted by Melrose Action on August 03, 2021 in Los Angeles, California. LAPD officers lead a one mile `Light The Night Safety Walk&#39; at the event which promoted police-community relationships.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Mario Tama/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><p>Qualified immunity was established in 1967 as a result of the <a href=\"https://scholar.google.com/scholar_case?case=4871005922110746242&q=pierson+v+ray&hl=en&as_sdt=6,47;as_sdt=6,47\">Pierson v. Ray US Supreme Court case</a>. The court ruled that so long as the misconduct or violation was executed in &#34;good faith,&#34; the law enforcement officer could rely on qualified immunity. </p><p>Critics of qualified immunity say that it&#39;s hard for plaintiffs to get accountability for alleged officer wrongdoing. This specific bill adjusts the Tom Bane Civil Rights Act of 1987 to &#34;make it easier for a family to seek justice if your civil rights have been violated, if you have been falsely arrested or framed or brutalized or denied medical assistance,&#34; Bradford told Spectrum News 1.</p><p>Those who support qualified immunity say it allows officers to do their jobs without worrying about potential individual lawsuits. And the part of the bill that tweaks qualified immunity is opposed by law enforcement groups.</p><p>&#34;If this bill was just about decertification, we&#39;d probably have no issue with it, but it&#39;s not, and they call it the decertification bill, but it&#39;s much more than that,&#34; Shaun Rundle, deputy director for the California Peace Officers&#39; Association, <a href=\"https://spectrumnews1.com/ca/la-west/inside-the-issues/2021/05/13/california-bill-would-create-a-system-to-get-rid-of-dangerous-cops\">told Spectrum News 1.</a></p><p>In a statement to CapRadio, Brian Marvel, President of the Peace Officers Research Association of California, said &#34;SB 2 reaches far beyond the police licensing process and includes policies that would be incredibly burdensome on cities and counties that employ peace officers.&#34;</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The National Police Support Fund, a grassroots pro-police organization, believes that qualified immunity is necessary for police officers to do their jobs.</p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\">&#34;As homicides and other violent crimes continue to rise around the country, qualified immunity is essential for allowing police to do their jobs without fear of baseless legal action that could ruin their reputations and their careers,&#34; the organization said in an article on their website.</p><p>&#34;Officers must have room to make mistakes or have moments of bad judgment without worrying about being sued,&#34; the National Police Support Fund said on their site.</p><p>Insider reached out to several California police departments and lawmakers who declined to comment on the bill.</p><p>The Los Angeles DA&#39;s office, now run by George Gascón, however, released a press statement saying it was in support of the bill. </p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><em>Send tips to this reporter at tmitchell@insider.com or on Twitter @taiylersimone.</em></p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><em>Update 9/10/2021: This article was revised from a previous version to reflect the correct date for the governor to sign the bill.  </em></p><p style=\"font-weight: 400;\"><em>Update 9/30/2021: This article was updated with the news that Gov. Gavin Newsom signed the bill into law.</em></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/california-bill-could-mean-the-end-of-qualified-immunity-2021-8'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a (Taiyler Simone Mitchell)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/612d3b639ef1e50018f8cfe6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn79@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-32-695_aa15d03a3a541d97.webp","https://i.insider.com/612d355012b9cc0019636767?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn24@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-10-648_bfdb1aae44bdae68.webp","https://i.insider.com/612d3f7712b9cc0019636b5e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn43@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-30-084_834821e8267f84f3.webp","https://i.insider.com/612d408512b9cc0019636bbf?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn27@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-33-147_e242f2acdafd5eba.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ToMvC-TDPuU:oVKRfp-6nHc:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn51@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-214_5740e36dc6fc4711.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ToMvC-TDPuU:oVKRfp-6nHc:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn76@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-30-370_69637f55c9f0ff3d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=ToMvC-TDPuU:oVKRfp-6nHc:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn72@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-31-800_1977d7b68c989954.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/ToMvC-TDPuU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn91@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-30-967_2880786e0a8f2990.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085856},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"A Democratic senator mistook the slang word 'finsta' for one of Facebook's products in a hearing with the company","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/finsta-senator-blumenthal-instagram-congress-hearing-facebook-2021-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/60590990106eb50019d05018?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Instagram logo on phone\" height=\"1635\" width=\"2180\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The U.S. Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, &#38; Transportation held a hearing on Thursday regarding Facebook&#39;s, Instagram, and mental health, spurred on by a Wall Street Journal investigation about what Facebook knows about the impact of Instagram on young users.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Thomas Trutschel/Photothek via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>The Senate Commerce Committee held a Thursday hearing about Facebook, Instagram, and mental health.</li>\n<li>Sen. Blumental of Connecticut asked if Facebook would &#34;commit to banning Finsta.&#34;</li>\n<li>&#34;Finstas,&#34; secret accounts some teens make, are not an official Facebook product. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>During a Senate Commerce Committee hearing on Thursday regarding Facebook&#39;s <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Ffacebook-documents-instagram-teens-11632953840\">research</a> on the impact of Instagram on young girls, Sen. Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut asked Facebook&#39;s Global Head of Safety Antigone Davis if the company would &#34;commit to ending Finsta.&#34; With the comment, he appeared to mistake the term for a Facebook product, when it&#39;s actually a slang term for secret accounts that some teens create to limit the audience of certain posts. </p><p>Sen. Blumental asked Davis about &#34;finsta towards the end of the hearing (at the 2:44:50 mark in the <a href=\"https://www.commerce.senate.gov/2021/9/protecting-kids-online-facebook-instagram-and-mental-health-harms\">publicly available webcast</a>). A clip of the interaction, uploaded by news curation editor Eric Morrow of BuzzFeed News, began to circulate on Twitter. </p><blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet blockquote\" data-lang=\"en\" data-cards=\"\" data-conversation=\"\">-Eric Morrow  (@morroweric) <a href=\"https://twitter.com/mims/statuses/1443628623576109065?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">September 30, 2021</a></blockquote><script async=\"\" src=\"//platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script><p>&#34;Finsta&#34; (fake Instagram) is a <a href=\"https://www.insider.com/finstas-secret-instagram-gen-z-use-for-privacy-2019-6\">slang term used to refer to smaller, side accounts that people</a> - frequently teenagers - make on Instagram. The accounts are typically used to broadcast content for small audiences like close friends, as opposed to sharing information or photos with wider audiences on users&#39; main accounts that could be followed by acquaintances or family members. &#34;Finsta&#34; is not a Facebook product, nor a clearly demarcated feature on Instagram - it&#39;s simply a secondary account that people create, which has become a cultural trend. </p><p>&#34;We don&#39;t actually do &#39;finsta.&#39; What &#39;finsta&#39; refers to is young people setting up accounts where they may want to have more privacy,&#34; Davis said, explaining that finstas aren&#39;t necessary made to secure privacy from parents, but rather to limit audiences in certain cases.</p><p>&#34;&#39;Finsta&#39; is one of your products or services. We&#39;re not talking about Google, or Apple, it&#39;s Facebook, correct?&#34; Blumenthal asked. </p><p>Davis explained again that the term is slang for a particular kind of account, to which Sen. Blumenthal asked again if Facebook would commit to ending them. </p><p>&#34;I&#39;m not sure I understand exactly what you&#39;re asking,&#34; Davis said.</p><p>Blumenthal had previously opened a line of questioning regarding &#34;finstas&#34; during the hearing, saying that they were frequently created with the intent to &#34;avoid parents&#39; oversight&#34; and alleging that Facebook was &#34;monetizing kids deceiving their parents,&#34; raising concerns regarding parental oversight. </p><p>The hearing, convened by Sen. Blumenthal, who is the Chair of the Subcommittee on Consumer Protection, Product Safety, and Data Security, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Ffacebook-knows-instagram-is-toxic-for-teen-girls-company-documents-show-11631620739%3Fmod%3Darticle_inline\">came in the wake  Wall Street Journal investigation</a> that revealed that Facebook knew the impact that its photo-sharing and commerce platform Instagram had on teen girls. In a <a href=\"https://about.fb.com/news/2021/09/research-teen-well-being-and-instagram/\">blog post</a>, Facebook argued against the Journal&#39;s characterization of the research that formed the basis for the story. On Wednesday, the Wall Street Journal <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Ffacebook-documents-instagram-teens-11632953840\">published six of the documents it based its investigation on.</a></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Flivecoverage%2Ffacebook-hearing-live-updates\">The Wall Street Journal reported that</a> internal Facebook research documents said that &#34;teens&#39; growing use of secondary accounts and &#39;Finstas&#39; suggest a strong market product fit for exploring different sides of themselves and interests.&#34;</p><p><strong data-stringify-type=\"bold\"><a href=\"https://www.insider.com/culture\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" data-sk=\"tooltip_parent\">Read more stories from Insider&#39;s Digital Culture desk.</a></strong></p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a Throughout the season, NFL games are spread across five primary channels: ESPN, NBC, Fox, CBS, and the NFL Network. Meanwhile, the next Super Bowl will be broadcast on NBC.</p><p>To help ensure you get access to every game you want to watch, we broke down the ins and outs of streaming the NFL season without a cable subscription.</p><h2>NFL Week 4 schedule</h2><p>Week four of the NFL regular season includes a Sunday Night Football matchup between the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and New England Patriots on NBC and Peacock. This week&#39;s Monday Night Football game will feature the Las Vegas Raiders and Los Angeles Chargers on ESPN.</p><p>Primetime games are shown nationally, but local broadcasts for afternoon games are determined by your area. Byes will not start until after week four.</p><table style=\"border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; height: 445px;\" border=\"1\"><tbody><tr style=\"height: 22px;\"><td style=\"width: 33.3333%; height: 22px;\"><p><strong>Game</strong></p></td><td style=\"width: 33.3333%; height: 22px;\">October 4, 8:15 p.m. ET</td><td style=\"width: 33.3333%; height: 22px;\">ESPN</td></tr></tbody></table><h2>How to watch NFL games without cable</h2><p>You can access select NFL games without a cable subscription via streaming services like <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&mid=42392&u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tvom%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a>, <a href=\"https://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/6415797/type/dlg/https://www.sling.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Sling TV</a>, <a href=\"http://www.fubo.tv/welcome?irad=343747&irmp=196318&subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcometv%2Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">FuboTV</a>, <a href=\"https://tv.youtube.com/welcome/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">YouTube TV</a>, <a href=\"https://paramountplus.qflm.net/c/196318/175360/3065?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paramountplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Paramount Plus</a>, <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/l/16256994011?ref_=assoc_tag_ph_1501285904297&_encoding=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=pf4&tag=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football-20&linkId=4a8bbbba81cb420528b28bd963f8fca681cb420528b28bd963f8fca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Amazon Prime Video,</a> <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.peacocktv.com%2Fwatch%2Fhome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Peacock Premium</a>, and <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">NFL Sunday Ticket</a>. You can also watch local NFL games with an <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-hdtv-indoor-antenna\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">HDTV antenna</a>.</p><p>The 2021 NFL regular season began on September 9. During the regular season, Sunday afternoon games with an NFC home team will typically air on Fox, and Sunday afternoon games with an AFC home team will typically air on CBS.</p><p>Meanwhile, Sunday Night Football airs on NBC, and Thursday Night Football will broadcast on NFL Network all season long. Select Thursday Night Football games will also be shown on Fox and streamed via <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/l/16256994011?ref_=assoc_tag_ph_1501285904297&_encoding=UTF8&camp=1789&creative=9325&linkCode=pf4&tag=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football-20&linkId=4a8bbbba81cb420528b28bd963f8fca681cb420528b28bd963f8fca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Amazon Prime</a> and Twitch. Finally, Monday Night Football is on ESPN. </p><p>Additionally, you can stream all your local in-market games on your mobile device for free using the Yahoo Sports app or the NFL app.</p><h3>Here&#39;s a full roundup of all the services you can use to stream NFL games without cable.</h3>\n<div id=\"slideshow\">\n\tHDTV Antenna\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fdbdfebc910a400192e836d?format=jpeg\" alt=\"one by one antenna\" height=\"1650\" width=\"2200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>You can purchase an antenna, like this <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00IF70QCW/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8&#38;tag=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football-20&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=as2&#38;creativeASIN=B00IF70QCW&#38;linkId=d0080fd5a51a45bd3d914f7a8afb9131\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">1 By One model</a>, to add to your TV for about $24, giving you access to local channels within a certain distance.&#160;</p><h3><strong>What you get:</strong></h3><p>Hooking up an HD antenna to your TV gives you access to local over-the-air (OTA) signals in your location. This means that you will be able to access the local affiliates of major broadcast networks, like Fox, CBS, and NBC.</p><p>This lets you watch all the regional games broadcast from wherever you're located. You also get the Sunday Night Football matchup that airs on NBC. Because it's only a one-time payment, this is a great option if you're solely interested in watching the team in your area. However, you will not get access to any out-of-market games or games that air on ESPN or the NFL Network.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5fdc2b2fc7bd856550330c74\" data-purchase-option=\"\"></bi-shortcode>\n\tSling TV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5270947ed0ee001e25d92f?format=jpeg\" alt=\"How Much is Sling TV 4x3\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alyssa Powell/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're looking for a live TV streaming service to watch football,&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=1630694759524rh2mq4y0&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anrdoezrs.net%2Flinks%2F6415797%2Ftype%2Fdlg%2Fsid%2Fxid-fr1630694763370cjj%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.sling.com%2F&#38;xid=fr1630694763370cjj\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-orig-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=1630694759524rh2mq4y0&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anrdoezrs.net%2Flinks%2F6415797%2Ftype%2Fdlg%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.sling.com%2F\" data-ml-id=\"7\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1630694763370cjj\" data-uri=\"dbc445d3f37e0da1c11393953db6222d\">Sling TV</a>&#160;is a great budget option that gives you most of the channels you need at a cheaper price than&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=16306947595242pd2fj6e&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fclick.linksynergy.com%2Fdeeplink%3Fid%3DEHFxW6yx8Uo%26mid%3D42392%26u1%3Dbiip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football%7Cxid%3Afr1630694763370jic%26murl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.hulu.com%252Flive-tv&#38;u1=1630694760967aqd3geb3l&#38;xid=fr1630694763370jic\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-orig-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=16306947595242pd2fj6e&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fclick.linksynergy.com%2Fdeeplink%3Fid%3DEHFxW6yx8Uo%26mid%3D42392%26u1%3Dbiip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football%26murl%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.hulu.com%252Flive-tv&#38;u1=1630694760967aqd3geb3l\" data-ml-id=\"8\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1630694763370jic\" data-uri=\"bb3182e8904d81651997f50a3970a599\">Hulu</a>&#160;or&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=16306947595247x1i0mvq&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcome%3Firad%3D343747%26irmp%3D196318%26subId1%3Dbiip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football%26u%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fwww.fubo.tv%252Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"51537b649d434c061168beaab43ddfae\">FuboTV</a>.</p><p>There are three different plans, depending on what channels you prioritize. Sling Orange and Sling Blue each cost $35 a month, while the combined Sling Orange + Blue plan costs $50 per month. Additionally, you can purchase the Sports Extra package to add NFL RedZone to your plan for $11 per month.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Sling Orange has ESPN, while Sling Blue has Fox and NBC in select markets as well as the NFL network. CBS is not currently offered by Sling. While there is a Sports Extra package, it does not include any channels that air live NFL games.&#160;</p><p>Your best bet to get access to the most NFL games via Sling is to sign up for the&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=1630694759524mslg0udm&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anrdoezrs.net%2Flinks%2F6415797%2Ftype%2Fdlg%2Fsid%2Fxid-fr1630694763370eda%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.sling.com%2F&#38;xid=fr1630694763370eda\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-orig-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=1630694759524mslg0udm&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anrdoezrs.net%2Flinks%2F6415797%2Ftype%2Fdlg%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.sling.com%2F\" data-ml-id=\"9\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1630694763370eda\" data-uri=\"f0a8cacef284f68573b742e74465d3fb\">Sling Orange + Blue plan</a>&#160;and cash in on Sling's current promotional offer of a&#160;<a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=16306947595240q7ytcak&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anrdoezrs.net%2Flinks%2F6415797%2Ftype%2Fdlg%2Fsid%2Fxid-fr1630694763370gjg%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.sling.com%2Fdeals%3Ffooter&#38;xid=fr1630694763370gjg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-orig-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?platform=browser&#38;postSource=bi%7C6128eefc654b022cb22353d2&#38;sc=false&#38;sessionid=16306947595240q7ytcak&#38;type=ALREADY-AFFILIATE-LINK-NOT-AMAZON&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.anrdoezrs.net%2Flinks%2F6415797%2Ftype%2Fdlg%2Fhttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.sling.com%2Fdeals%3Ffooter\" data-ml-id=\"10\" data-ml=\"true\" data-xid=\"fr1630694763370gjg\" data-uri=\"ac568e52caf834cfcc8a387fd6c4e9d6\">free antenna</a>&#160;for local channels. The free antenna requires that you prepay for two months of the Sling service. Plus, if you want RedZone you can add the Sports Extra package to the Orange + Blue Plan for a total of $61 a month.</p><p>If you don't want it all, you can just sign up for Sling Blue to gain access to Sunday afternoon games on Fox and Sunday Night Football games on NBC, or just Sling Orange to gain access to Monday Night games on ESPN, in addition to the local offerings included with the antenna. As with all streaming services, game availability is subject to&#160;<a href=\"https://www.fcc.gov/consumers/guides/sports-blackouts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"20\" data-uri=\"6118ad3b851ef7cbe273d7623c6a9d22\">blackouts</a>.</p><p>With Sling's channel listings, add-ons, and the fact that they provide a free antenna, you can gain access to all local channels, the NFL Network, ESPN, and NFL RedZone, making it one of the most cost-effective ways to watch the NFL without cable.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5da63b964af909432430f8b2\" data-purchase-option=\"\">TV (small)</bi-shortcode>\n\tHulu with Live TV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5270f9e6ff30001d4e72a6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Hulu Basic vs Hulu Premium 4x3\" height=\"1800\" width=\"2400\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>In addition to all of its other offerings, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=42392&#38;u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">Hulu + Live TV</a> has nearly everything you need to stream NFL games for $65 per month. However, like Sling TV, there's no option to add the NFL Network or NFL RedZone as a channel, which could be a deal-breaker if you're hoping to watch and monitor action across the league.</p><h3>What you get:&#160;</h3><p>Like an HD antenna, <a href=\"https://click.linksynergy.com/deeplink?id=EHFxW6yx8Uo&#38;mid=42392&#38;u1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;murl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hulu.com%2Flive-tv\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Hulu + Live TV</a> gets you access to all the local affiliates of the major broadcasts, meaning Fox, CBS, and NBC. These will show the games that are within your regional broadcast map with the exception of any <a href=\"https://www.fcc.gov/consumers/guides/sports-blackouts\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">blackouts</a>. In addition, you also get ESPN, which gives you access to all Monday Night Football games, and some of the best NFL coverage and analysis on TV.&#160;</p><p>While you don't get access to watch out-of-network games from across the country like you do with NFL RedZone or NFL Sunday Ticket, this is a comprehensive way to tune into most locally and nationally televised games. Hulu does not offer a way to watch the first three regular Thursday Night Football games, however, since those will be aired on NFL Network.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5e18fba0b2e66a3b703df013\" data-purchase-option=\"\"></bi-shortcode>\n\tFuboTV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5271187ed0ee001e25d933?format=jpeg\" alt=\"FuboTV\" height=\"600\" width=\"800\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">FuboTV</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>At $65 a month for the Starter Plan, <a href=\"http://www.fubo.tv/welcome?irad=343747&#38;irmp=196318&#38;subId1=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football&#38;u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fubo.tv%2Fwelcome\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener nofollow sponsored\">FuboTV</a> is one of the most comprehensive yet expensive live streaming options for NFL football. You can also spend an extra $11 per month to add the Sports Plus with NFL RedZone package.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>In terms of NFL games, the Starter Plan includes access to local CBS, NBC, and Fox stations (<a href=\"https://support.fubo.tv/hc/en-us/articles/360015622031-What-NFL-games-can-I-watch-on-fuboTV-this-week-\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">regional availability and blackout restrictions apply</a>). FuboTV's Starter Plan also grants you access to ESPN to watch Monday Night Football, and NFL Network to stream Thursday Night Football all season long.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5e1f7fd324306a1d0b4da52b\" data-purchase-option=\"\"></bi-shortcode>\n\tYouTube TV\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5271c4e6ff30001d4e72ac?format=jpeg\" alt=\"YouTubeTV NFL Network\" height=\"1200\" width=\"1600\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">YouTube</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>With a base price of $65 a month, YouTube TV is another service that offers access to most NFL games. Additionally, the service <a href=\"https://nflcommunications.com/Pages/NFL-Network-and-YouTubeTV-Reach-New-Carriage-Agreement.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">announced</a> an agreement with the NFL to offer NFL Redzone as an add-on included in their Sports Plus package for an additional $11 a month.&#160;</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Like other services at this price range, YouTube TV offers access to all the local channels you need to watch NFL games, including CBS, Fox, and NBC. YouTube TV also offers ESPN and NFL Network in their base package, so you'll be able to watch all Monday Night Football and Thursday Night Football games. And with the news of the new Sports Plus package, you can also watch NFL Redzone for an additional $11 per month.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5e1f7e01b6d52d1b7108fd25\" data-purchase-option=\"\"></bi-shortcode>\n\tNFL Sunday Ticket\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5ec69f755af6cc4bd1301f04?format=jpeg\" alt=\"NFL logo\" height=\"1885\" width=\"2514\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">REUTERS/Carlo Allegri</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>NFL Sunday Ticket used to only be available with a cable subscription, but NFL fans in non-DirecTV markets anywhere in the country can now gain access to every Sunday afternoon game.</p><p>There are two separate plans available: The <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NFL Sunday Ticket To Go plan costs $73.49 per month</a> for four months, which is $293.96 total. There is also the <a href=\"https://nflst.directv.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NFL Sunday Ticket Max plan for $99 per month</a> for four months, adding up to $396 total.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Both plans give you access to all out-of-market Sunday afternoon games. This means that you do not get access to Thursday, Sunday, or Monday night games. You also won't be able to stream locally televised games with only an NFL Sunday Ticket subscription. However, this is the only way for people hoping to watch full live games of their favorite teams out of market. A fun feature included in both plans is that you can watch four games at once on your screen.</p><p>In addition to the normal features, NFL Sunday Ticket Max adds in NFL RedZone and the DirecTV Fantasy Zone, which is a new channel solely dedicated watching games through the lens of fantasy football.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5f5134c2724609260a1fdab6\" data-purchase-option=\"\"></bi-shortcode>\n\tParamount Plus\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f5a8d377ed0ee001e25ea83?format=jpeg\" alt=\"CBS All Access NFL\" height=\"440\" width=\"586\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">CBS</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're just interested in watching locally televised AFC home games, then a <a href=\"https://paramountplus.qflm.net/c/196318/175360/3065?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.paramountplus.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Paramount Plus subscription</a> could be all you need. The service lets you stream live CBS television, as well as a growing library of on-demand shows and exclusive titles. Paramount Plus is available for $5 a month with commercials or $10 a month with ad-free streaming. With that said, all live broadcasts, including NFL games, still feature commercials with the ad-free plan.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Paramount Plus offers live streaming for every NFL game that airs on the regular CBS channel in your local market. However, since Paramount Plus only offers CBS content you won't be able to watch any games that air on other networks or any out of market matches. You can see a <a href=\"https://cbsallaccess.qflm.net/c/196318/175360/3065?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cbs.com%2Fshows%2Fnfl-on-cbs%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">full schedule of NFL games set to air on CBS here</a>.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"602411f288948700119fe18f\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Essential Monthly Plan (ad-supported) (small)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"60be615ccfcc2d0018f40db2\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Premium Monthly Plan (ad-free) (small)</bi-shortcode>\n\tPeacock Premium\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61324d51a1e5e7001996c2e7?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Peacock Sports\" height=\"662\" width=\"1324\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Peacock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Peacock won't be streaming any exclusive games during the 2021 season, but Premium subscribers can stream all the NFL games being broadcast on NBC.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>For $5 a month, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.peacocktv.com%2F\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Peacock Premium</a> will give you streaming access to NBC's Sunday Night Football games, as well as Super Bowl LVI, the Thanksgiving game between the Buffalo Bills and New Orleans Saints, and the 2021 kick-off game between the Dallas Cowboys and Tampa Bay Buccaneers.</p><p>The NFL's flex scheduling gives NBC the option to change the Sunday Night Football game of the week, which typically guarantees that the primetime game will be one of the week's best matchups.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5f610fe1be509c694327621c\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Premium (Monthly Plan) (small)</bi-shortcode>\n\tAmazon Prime Video\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f52747b7ed0ee001e25d95c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Amazon NFL football\" height=\"650\" width=\"870\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Amazon</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>Though yon won't get local channels, NFL Network, or in-depth analysis, Amazon Prime Video members can watch select Thursday Night Football games with their subscription for no additional cost. A standalone Amazon Prime Video membership costs $9 a month, and the service is included as part of an <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/l/16256994011?ref_=assoc_tag_ph_1501285904297&#38;_encoding=UTF8&#38;camp=1789&#38;creative=9325&#38;linkCode=pf4&#38;tag=biip_090419_how-to-watch-nfl-football-20&#38;linkId=4a8bbbba81cb420528b28bd963f8fca6\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Amazon Prime</a> subscription for $119 per year or $13 a month.</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>Amazon Prime Video will stream 11 Thursday Night Football games starting week five of the season. These game will also be broadcast on NFL Network and Fox. Since Amazon won't be streaming any additional games, Prime Video on its own is really only suitable for casual football fans who just want to stream a few games this season.&#160;</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5da8618acc4a0a2aa85fef22\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Prime Video Monthly Subscription (small)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"5e28784d24306a101e35ab35\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Prime Monthly Subscription (small)</bi-shortcode>\n\tYahoo Sports app and NFL app\n\t<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5f63cbc157b7da001ee125b9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Yahoo Sports app NFL\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Yahoo</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure>\n\t<p>If you're only interested in watching in-market games without cable or an antenna, then you can stream live local and primetime games on a mobile device using the <a href=\"https://mobile.yahoo.com/sports\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Yahoo Sports</a> or <a href=\"https://www.nfl.com/apps/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">NFL app</a>. Both options are free and each app is available on iOS and Android smartphones and tablets.&#160;</p><h3>What you get:</h3><p>These apps provide live streaming for regular season local and primetime games, playoffs, and the Super Bowl. With that said, you can only watch the games on a mobile device. You'll also need to ensure that your location services are activated on your phone or tablet.</p>\n</div><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a (Danny Bakst,Kevin Webb)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/5d717d762e22af7862365c65?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn47@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-34-381_d38ee9b74bcd0f61.webp","https://i.insider.com/5fdbdfebc910a400192e836d?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn95@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-34-991_6bb680c3c8a7db8a.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5270947ed0ee001e25d92f?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-34-607_7f0b42b4941c966f.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5270f9e6ff30001d4e72a6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn15@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-35-583_e17bb1fbd1c59336.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5271187ed0ee001e25d933?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn78@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-33-546_c89e3686d6d6a4e7.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5271c4e6ff30001d4e72ac?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn43@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-34-579_b95e949b0f4f51e0.webp","https://i.insider.com/5ec69f755af6cc4bd1301f04?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn23@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-32-682_2b170d730408072c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f5a8d377ed0ee001e25ea83?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn15@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-32-373_cdd4ad43d1127df3.webp","https://i.insider.com/61324d51a1e5e7001996c2e7?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn62@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-35-133_182991b0f085bf6c.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f52747b7ed0ee001e25d95c?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn56@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-33-066_13e7d0ff5e734cf9.webp","https://i.insider.com/5f63cbc157b7da001ee125b9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn3@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-31-512_b656b530b44d504d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9o-wHq3OVAY:d17HBjxe6Fw:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn56@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-32-288_15e49e2aa1e61f96.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9o-wHq3OVAY:d17HBjxe6Fw:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn31@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-35-788_331f89dc57b6c7c2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=9o-wHq3OVAY:d17HBjxe6Fw:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn3@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-32-714_77ab4eea6d5898fd.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/9o-wHq3OVAY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn47@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-30-476_b1ab062ec3c32217.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085837},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"More than 100 American evacuees from Afghanistan landed safely in the US after initially being denied entry","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/us-evacuees-from-afghanistan-land-after-initially-being-denied-entry-2021-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6156400bb414c10018633e0b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"A view of a terminal building at the Kabul International Airport\" height=\"663\" width=\"1327\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>A view of a terminal building at the Kabul International Airport.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Photo by Stringer\\TASS via Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>A private charter carrying US evacuees out of Afghanistan landed in Chicago on Tuesday.</li>\n<li>The plane was initially denied entry by the US State Department, according to organizers.</li>\n<li>&#34;They were trapped for the moment and it sucked, but they were at least safe,&#34; a volunteer told Insider.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>A private charter flight carrying more than 100 American citizens out of Afghanistan landed safely in the US on Thursday, despite a bureaucratic roadblock along the way.</p><p>The group of US citizens, green card holders, and special immigrant visa holders departed the Kabul airport on Tuesday after receiving clearance from the Taliban, according to Jen Wilson, a volunteer with the <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/project-dynamo-and-human-first-coalition-bring-americans-home-from-afghanistan-1030829092\">civilian rescue organization Project Dynamo.</a></p><p>The organization believes theirs is the first private rescue mission to escape Afghanistan since the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/inside-kabul-aid-worker-reveals-chaos-of-us-afghanistan-evacuation-2021-9?r=US&IR=TIR=T\">US military left the country</a> at the end of August.</p><p>But shortly after departing the country earlier this week, the mission encountered another hurdle: the Department of Homeland Security <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/afganistan-evacuation-plane-us-citizens-homeland-security-refused-entry-report-2021-9\">would not allow the charter flight to land in the US.</a></p><p>As soon as the plane took off, Wilson said the crew&#39;s flight clearance for John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York was revoked. When the plane rerouted to Dulles International Airport in Virginia, the same thing happened.</p><p>&#34;And then we went to Philly and Philly did the same, and then suddenly it was all ports of entry,&#34; Wilson said. </p><p>&#34;It was heartbreaking. It was infuriating,&#34; she said. &#34;Because we had just caught the high after we got them out and saved them. We were all crying the minute they went wheels up from Kabul and were so relieved.&#34;</p><p>A spokesperson from the State Department acknowledged the situation on Tuesday, telling <a href=\"https://thehill.com/policy/national-security/department-of-homeland-security/574417-dhs-not-allowing-charter-flight\">The Hill</a> that the agency was working to vet the travelers after they were stranded in the United Arab Emirates. Among the evacuated passengers were 59 children younger than 18 and 16 kids under the age of 3, according to <a href=\"https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/project-dynamo-and-human-first-coalition-bring-americans-home-from-afghanistan-301387183.html\">Project Dynamo</a>.</p><p>Wilson said their organization was initially told private charters weren&#39;t allowed into the US. After pushing back, the State Department reportedly cited a measles outbreak as cause for concern. But Wilson said all passengers on board had been vaccinated against the measles, mumps, and rubella. They were also tested and vaccinated against COVID-19.</p><p>Despite the setback, Wilson said the passengers were just grateful to be free of the Taliban.</p><p>&#34;They were trapped for the moment and it sucked, but they were at least safe,&#34; she said. </p><p>The State Department eventually granted the group entry into the US, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/us-bars-flight-landing-with-americans-kabul-activists-2021-09-29/\">saying</a> US Embassy staff in the United Arab Emirates worked around the clock to verify passenger information and coordinate with officials on the ground to ensure everyone was vetted before arriving in the US.</p><blockquote class=\"instagram-media\" style=\"background:#FFF; border:0; border-radius:3px; box-shadow:0 0 1px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.5),0 1px 10px 0 rgba(0,0,0,0.15); margin: 1px; max-width:540; padding:0; width:99.375%; width:-webkit-calc(100% - 2px); width:calc(100% - 2px); data.width~540;\">\n\t<div style=\"padding:8px;\">\n\t\t<div style=\"background:#F8F8F8; line-height:0; margin-top:40px; padding:62.4537037037% 0; text-align:center; width:100%;\">\n\t\t\t<div style=\"background:url(data:image/png;base64,);
