font-family:Arial,sans-serif; font-size:14px; line-height:17px; margin-bottom:0; margin-top:8px; overflow:hidden; padding:8px 0 7px; text-align:center; text-overflow:ellipsis; white-space:nowrap;\">A post shared by PROJECT DYNAMO (@projectdynamo)<time style=\" font-family:Arial,sans-serif; Project Dynamo <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/projectdynamo/\">celebrated the arrival on Instagram</a>.</p><p>Wilson said her organization was ecstatic to see American citizens back home safe, and pledged that Project Dynamo would continue  to run evacuations out of Afghanistan as long as it has the money to do so.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a (Erin Snodgrass,Sophia Ankel)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/6156400bb414c10018633e0b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn32@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-32-015_a22adc401f90a43b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=370xWteMZJw:SX-KZ3rnFHE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn47@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-32-910_36a5258ac2a95bda.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=370xWteMZJw:SX-KZ3rnFHE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn51@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-35-294_e9e9f5e7eeb6df27.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=370xWteMZJw:SX-KZ3rnFHE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn27@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-34-414_08eb76b72eae8ed8.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/370xWteMZJw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn44@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-32-731_7e1a458d9046e67f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085790},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"This wine club helps me figure out which types of wine I like best and what food to pair them with","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/winc-wine-review","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, Insider may earn an affiliate commission. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-reviews-expertise-in-product-reviews\">Learn more.</a></i></p><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.winc.com%2Ftry%2Flp1dynamicdiscount\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\"><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa075d791178a0019b3dc8c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Winc lead image\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></a></p><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Every month, wine club <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.winc.com%2Ftry%2Flp1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Winc</a> sends you a box of wines (starting at $13 per bottle) personalized to your tastes.</li>\n<li>It offers a wide variety of wines, including red, white, rosé, sparkling, and vegan.</li>\n<li>I&#39;ve used it multiple times and the service makes learning about wine approachable and convenient.</li>\n</ul><p><em>This content is intended for readers 21+. Please drink responsibly. If you or anyone you know is dealing with alcohol abuse, get help. The </em><a href=\"https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline\"><em>Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration&#39;s National Helpline</em></a><em> at 1-800-662-HELP (4357) provides a free, confidential, 24/7, treatment referral, and information service.</em></p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5db1b98ddee0190ff2107184\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Monthly Wine Subscription (3 bottles) (medium)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"table-of-contents-sticky\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"h2\">Table of Contents: Masthead Sticky</bi-shortcode><p>One of the most popular wine clubs in the nation doesn&#39;t require you to flash receipts for all the vineyards you&#39;ve visited in the past year. In fact, the less you know about wine, the more you&#39;ll probably enjoy <a href=\"https://winc.mivh.net/c/196318/583994/9573?subId1=biip_061219_winc-wine-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\">Winc</a>, an online winery and wine club that wants to make exploring wine simpler and more enjoyable.</p><h2>What is Winc?<a href=\"https://winc.mivh.net/c/196318/583994/9573?subId1=biip_061219_winc-wine-review\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored\"></a></h2><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-type=\"5a6b8e5c1784254f0f8b4d6d\" data-title=\"The 6 best wine subscriptions we tested in 2021\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-club\" data-thumbnail=\"https://i.insider.com/5ffde336f3df630018cc1612\">Related Article Module: The 6 best wine subscriptions we tested in 2021</bi-shortcode><p><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.winc.com%2Ftry%2Flp1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Winc</a> is a California-based winery co-founded by sommelier Brian Smith. It uses an online Palate Profile and your own ratings to recommend and ship the best wines for your tastes, so you don&#39;t spend an inordinate amount of time in the wine aisle deciphering labels and ultimately just choosing the one that looks the prettiest. There&#39;s no fee or commitment to join, and you can skip the month&#39;s shipment any time you want. If you don&#39;t like the idea of a monthly subscription, the brand also offers an a la carte shop for members, with discounted pricing on wines.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa076dc69331a0011bc6d5c?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Winc intro image\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Winc/Instagram</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Though I wouldn&#39;t call myself a complete amateur and I know generally what types of wine I like, I am also eons away from becoming that person at the party who casually swishes her glass and rattles off tasting notes. Instead, I am more often the person who gushes over the cheese and charcuterie paired with the wine.</p><p>But I do enjoy popping a bottle open for special and casual occasions alike, and <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.winc.com%2Ftry%2Flp1\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noopener sponsored nofollow sponsored\">Winc</a> is <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-wine-club\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">one of the services I use</a> to get me those bottles.</p><h2>How to use your Winc membership</h2><aside class=\"breakout-box headline-regular\"><ul><li><strong>Subscription frequency:</strong> Every month</li><li><strong>Shipping fee: </strong>$9 for orders of three bottles or fewer; free for orders of four bottles or more</li><li><strong>A la carte shop: </strong>Yes</li></ul></aside><p>New members will fill out a short questionnaire called the Palate Profile, which asks things like how you like your coffee, and how much you like flavors such as citrus and mushrooms. </p><p>Then, Winc offers a selection of wine bottles it thinks you should try. Winc works with vineyards and winemakers all over the world to make these varietals. Since its launch, Winc has produced more than 664 wines from 78 grape varieties and 97 regions across 12 different countries. You may see some of these wines also sold at Whole Foods, Vons, and Kroger stores. Winc uses subscriber data and ratings to decide what to produce next, so you&#39;ll see a lot of bottles that line up with emerging wine trends. </p><p>You can read up on the details of each bottle - its tasting notes, ratings from other Winc members, and its body and sweetness levels - before deciding whether to add it to your shipment. </p><p>Your monthly box includes three bottles, and you can add as many additional bottles as you&#39;d like. Shipping is $9 for orders of three bottles and free for any order larger than that. There are also regular discounts to take advantage of. </p><p>Anyone can order wines to be delivered at any time, but you&#39;ll get special discounted pricing if you become a member. On the 16th of every month, you&#39;ll be charged $59.95 and receive credits to buy four bottles of wine. Any unused credits can be rolled over, and you can always skip a month. </p><p>If you prefer even more flexibility, we recommend skipping the membership and buying wine from Winc whenever you want. You&#39;ll still be able to take and update your Palate Profile in order to receive recommendations. </p><h2>Review of Winc</h2><p>My bottles have always arrived securely packed in a box that also has a carry handle for convenient transport. In the past, shipments have come with a fun A-Z guide of important wine and Winc terms, but you can now find all this info, along with your specific bottles&#39; tasting notes, on the website.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa0777769331a0011bc6d61?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Winc 3 image\" height=\"900\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Connie Chen/Business Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>I don&#39;t usually love heavy, full-bodied wines, so I generally opt for lighter, medium-bodied bottles and a diverse variety of tasting notes. On your Winc profile, you can revisit the details of each wine and also figure out what types of food to pair it with. </p><p>In my most recent test of the service, I enjoyed the 2019 Pacificana Cabernet Sauvignon (currently unavailable), which was surprising because it&#39;s full-bodied. In the past, the 2018 Cape Route Chenin Blanc (no longer available) helped pave the way for my current love of the varietal. </p><p>If you really love a specific wine in your shipment, I recommend re-ordering it sooner rather than later. Winc is constantly updating its stock and product turnover is high, so there&#39;s no guarantee your favorite bottle will be there in a few weeks. </p><p>I haven&#39;t loved everything I&#39;ve tried through Winc, including a Touriga Nacional and a Valdiguié, but I ultimately appreciated that the site even offered so many varietals for me to try. With Winc, I&#39;ve been able to learn more about what wines to avoid and what wines to explore more. Anyway, I&#39;m able to rate all my bottles on my Winc profile so I could get better recommendations for my next box. In addition to a star rating, you can enter notes to refer back to later.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/5fa16dcf69331a0011bc6eda?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Winc ratings image\" height=\"600\" width=\"1200\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Winc</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The next time you visit the Wines page, your recommended bottles will float right to the top, making it easy to add them to your box. Other than the provided recommendations, feel free to browse the rest of Winc&#39;s wines, which include categories like Sparkling, Vegan, and California. The site is easy to navigate and neatly organized so you can find exactly what you want, while also providing enough discovery opportunities to help you stumble upon something new and interesting. </p><h2>The bottom line</h2><p>There&#39;s no need to be stuffy about or intimidated by wine - Winc&#39;s easy-to-use platform lets you get past your limited wine experience to fully enjoy a glass (or two, or three).</p><p>Its wine is also pretty affordable, starting at just $13 and maxing out around $32 per bottle. If you want to discover your next favorite wine without spending a lot of money or pulling your hair out over its complexities, there&#39;s no better place than Winc.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"medium\" data-pid=\"5db1b98ddee0190ff2107184\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Monthly Wine Subscription (3 bottles) (medium)</bi-shortcode><div 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"SEC's Gary Gensler warns a lot of people are 'likely to get hurt' without crypto rules like those for bank deposits, insurance","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/gary-gensler-sec-chair-cryptocurrency-rules-regulation-people-hurt-2021-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6108ff5dc31de7001849e93e?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Gary Gensler SEC Chair Securities and Exchange Commission\" height=\"1500\" width=\"3000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Gary Gensler became chair of the SEC in April.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Alex Wong/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Gary Gensler warned that crypto investors are &#34;likely to get hurt&#34; if the digital asset space does not have rules in place.</li>\n<li>The SEC chair also said crypto platforms that ask users to invest money for returns will be regulated. </li>\n<li>His comments came after Coinbase abandoned its plans for Lend, its crypto lending program.</li>\n<li><a href=\"https://newsletter.businessinsider.com/join/4np/10-things-opening-bell?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\"><strong>Sign up here for our daily newsletter, 10 Things Before the Opening Bell</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>US Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Gary Gensler warned that cryptocurrency investors are &#34;likely to get hurt&#34; if the digital asset space does not have the same kind of protection against fraud and manipulation that certain traditional banking instruments have. </p><p>&#34;This crypto space is now certainly of a size that without those investor protections of banking, insurance [and] securities laws [and] market oversight, I do think somebody is going to get hurt,&#34; Gensler said during the <a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/3e8f6c2f-6580-40f6-b6df-3368bb5f20d1\">Financial Times&#39; Future of Asset Management North America conference.</a> &#34;A lot of people are likely to get hurt.&#34;</p><p>The SEC chief also said crypto platforms that ask users to invest money for returns will be regulated. As such, they &#34;should consider the securities laws carefully and talk to the agency about getting registered.&#34;</p><p>If they have not registered in the past - as they should have - Gensler said they should do so now.</p><p>His comments came after <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/stocks/coin-stock?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingest?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestm=ingest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Coinbase Global</a> on September 20 announced it was <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/coinbase-crypto-lending-program-sec-lend-abandons-usdc-apy-waitlist-2021-9\">abandoning plans for Lend</a>, its crypto lending program that drew the ire of the SEC. Announced in June, Lend would&#39;ve allowed customers to earn 4% interest on their cryptocurrency holdings by lending tokens.</p><p>The decision to ditch the Lend program was revealed after Gensler <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/sec-gary-gensler-crypto-regulation-exchanges-coinbase-securities-lending-2021-9?utm_source=markets&utm_medium=ingestgest\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">hardened his stance against crypto exchanges</a>. The SEC had also warned Coinbase it was planning to take enforcement action, saying its Lend product was considered a security. </p><p>Still, Coinbase has other plans to further integrate digital assets into the realm of traditional banking. On Monday, the company unveiled a new feature that will allow <a href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/currencies/coinbase-direct-deposit-paycheck-salary-cryptocurrency-no-transactino-fee-usd-2021-9\">users to deposit their paychecks directly</a> into their accounts on the cryptocurrency exchange.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2021 19:20:20 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/6108ff58c31de7001849e93a?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"918e3464c154725519b9127b1af7cb2d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn91@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-29-891_c4d5227981b6e4ef.webp","destWidth":2755,"destHeight":2062,"sourceBytes":147308,"destBytes":147308,"author":"ilee@insider.com Lee)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/6108ff5dc31de7001849e93e?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn43@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-35-922_87176a5845536ba6.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mRTac0EcLNI:jp5tf1fCofE:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn91@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-36-110_a725f7086db63777.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mRTac0EcLNI:jp5tf1fCofE:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn79@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-31-121_980c3dfb40b85a0d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mRTac0EcLNI:jp5tf1fCofE:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn71@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-35-367_ba73d6a5f91dc46d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mRTac0EcLNI":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn40@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-606_cbdd2f005f2f549a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085725},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"Air fryers are a sham","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/toaster-oven-vs-air-fryer","description":"<p class=\"financial-disclaimer\"><i>When you buy through our links, Insider may earn an affiliate commission. <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insider-reviews-expertise-in-product-reviews\">Learn more.</a></i></p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/615619207b09e80018e5a3f3?format=jpeg\" alt=\"air fryer chicken\" height=\"2680\" width=\"3574\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>\n<p class=\"copyright\">Bubbers BB/Shuttershock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Air fryers are just small-capacity convection ovens that don&#39;t toast and are hard to clean.</li>\n<li>Simply put, they&#39;re a poor reinvention of the toaster and another unnecessary kitchen appliance.</li>\n<li>Here&#39;s why a traditional convection toaster oven will serve you worlds better.</li>\n</ul><p>Air &#34;fryers&#34; are a con. They are by name a fryer, but in function, no such thing at all. In truth, they are nothing but dumbed-down convection ovens made with cheap plastic. They offer less cooking surface area and fewer functions for a similar footprint on your countertop and end up being just one more clunky appliance neither you nor your kitchen ever needed. </p><h2>Here&#39;s why you should stay away from air fryers and buy a toaster oven instead:</h2><h3>Even our reporters who test air fryers don&#39;t really like them</h3><p>Our job is to tell you what to buy, and in some instances, we&#39;re assigned to review products we ourselves would never buy. We still consider, test, and review these products with every bit of the respect we give all products and services. At the end of the day, you&#39;re going to buy what you&#39;re going to buy and that&#39;s that. We respect your choice.</p><p>But the kindest thing our reporters, Jen Gushue and James Brains, who <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-air-fryer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">have tested dozens of the things</a>, have to say about air fryers is this: &#34;The results are more like oven roasting at a high heat - still a delicious end result, but you won&#39;t fool anyone into thinking you just pulled those chicken wings out of a <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-deep-fryer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">deep fryer</a>.&#34;</p><p>Essentially, an air fryer is a convection toaster that doesn&#39;t toast, which is absurd in my book.</p><h3>The term &#34;air fryer&#34; is just a marketing ploy for technology that has existed for decades</h3><p>This is a plea, not in condescension, not out of derision or scorn, but for the sake of all things honest and decent in the worldwide web of consumerism. Don&#39;t fall for marketing ploys that clutter your kitchen.</p><p>Convection cooking (the technology behind air fryers) has been around since the early 1900s, and in home kitchens since at least 1945 in the form of your trusty ol&#39; toaster oven. </p><p>With the addition of a wire tray and a metal sheet pan, any decent convection toaster oven will achieve what an air &#34;fryer&#34; can and more. It can bake, roast, and broil, and it can even <em>toast</em>! Oh, the novelty! Further, thanks to the internal fan that prevents hot and cold spots, a convection toaster oven arguably works better than the regular oven.</p><h3>Most air fryers are awkwardly shaped and sized</h3><p>Consider how many batches it would take to cook for even just two, let alone four, in an air fryer. And while the footprint might be a little smaller, it won&#39;t fit as neatly into a corner or beneath a cabinet in the way that a boxier, prettier, and usually stainless-steel convection toaster oven would.</p><h3>The bottom line: skip the air fryer, buy the toaster oven</h3><p>But for goodness sake, I implore you one more time to save your wallet, your precious counter space - and its aesthetic - and stay away from the bulbous, plastic, hard-to-clean, single-serve pod air fryers that everyone seems to be buying and hawking. Do yourself one better and just stick with the classic toaster oven you probably already have, and if you want to use it to air fry, a roasting pan and wire rack is all you need.</p><p>Below are convection toasters recommended by our expert home appliance tester and reviewer, James Brains, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/best-toaster-oven#check-out-our-other-buying-guides-for-small-appliances-9\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">who is in full agreement</a> that they will serve you far, far better.</p><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"60cba010229936001130f831\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Digital AirFryer Toaster Oven (small)</bi-shortcode><bi-shortcode id=\"commerce-link\" class=\"mceNonEditable\" data-cardtype=\"small\" data-pid=\"60cba28e4f035100117f3ce2\" data-purchase-option=\"\">Crisp &#39;N Bake Air Fry href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/storythreads/2021-09-21/why-is-everyone-talking-about-evergrande?cmpid=BBD092321_BIZ&utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=210923&utm_campaign=bloombergdaily&sref=BLKWHazcly&#38;sref=BLKWHazc\">1.4 70% of their wealth in real estate.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Evergrande, the second-biggest real-estate developer in China, has been dominating headlines for weeks. The company has more than <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/storythreads/2021-09-21/why-is-everyone-talking-about-evergrande?cmpid=BBD092321_BIZ&utm_medium=email&utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=210923&utm_campaign=bloombergdaily&sref=BLKWHazcly&#38;sref=BLKWHazc\">$300 billion in debt</a>, making it the most indebted company in the world. It also has <a href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/21/business/china-evergrande-bailout.html\">1.4 million</a> undelivered apartments hanging in the balance.</p><p>The global conversation around Evergrande has turned to a series of big questions, including whether China&#39;s central government will bail out the giant, and what Evergrande&#39;s long-term impact on the real-estate sector will be.</p><p>While analysts are now overwhelmingly predicting Beijing <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/09/21/dont-expect-beijing-to-provide-direct-support-to-evergrande-says-sp.html\">will not bail out</a> Evergrande, Dr. Xin Sun, a senior lecturer in Chinese and East Asian Business at King&#39;s College London, told Insider the long-term impact on the housing market and the entire economy is still highly uncertain.</p><p>&#34;What we see at the moment is that people are losing their previously very strong confidence in the real estate sector,&#34; Sun said. &#34;A main concern of the central government is trying to limit the contagion effect of an Evergrande collapse - if it collapses - from spreading to other developers.&#34;</p><p>We&#39;ve answered a few questions on China&#39;s housing market to help you understand the backdrop against which the unfolding Evergrande crisis is set.</p><h2>How big is China&#39;s real estate market?</h2><p>China&#39;s real-estate sector is huge. According to Goldman Sachs Group Inc., the total value of the market hit $52 trillion in 2019 - twice the size of the US residential housing market, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Fchina-property-real-estate-boom-covid-pandemic-bubble-11594908517\">The Wall Street Journal</a> reported. The sector accounts for <a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/ea1b79bf-cbe3-41d9-91da-0a1ba692309f?utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20210924&utm_term=5794355&utm_campaign=money&utm_id=5959001&orgid=330&utm_att1=nprnewsgid=330&#38;utm_att1=nprnews\">29%</a> of China&#39;s gross domestic product (GDP). And its cities are growing rapidly: In 2019, China recorded a 60% <a href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/c1144ffe-30f9-41d3-b033-bb82eca258b4?utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20210924&utm_term=5794355&utm_campaign=money&utm_id=5959001&orgid=330&utm_att1=nprnewsgid=330&#38;utm_att1=nprnews\">urbanization</a> rate.</p><p>But a lot of that real estate is empty. An estimated <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-02-27/vacant-apartments-strain-china-s-housing-market?sref=BLKWHazc&utm_source=npr_newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_content=20210924&utm_term=5794355&utm_campaign=money&utm_id=5959001&orgid=330&utm_att1=nprnewsp;orgid=330&#38;utm_att1=nprnews\">65 million homes</a> - 20% of the total supply - in China are unoccupied. Not only is this high by <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Fchina-property-real-estate-boom-covid-pandemic-bubble-11594908517\">international standards</a>, it means there are enough empty houses in China to house the entire <a href=\"https://www.worldometers.info/world-population/population-by-country/\">population</a> of France.</p><p>Homeownership rates in the country are also high. More than 90% of households in China are homeowners, according to a January research <a href=\"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7546956/\">paper</a> on homeownership in China from the National Center for Biotechnology Information. The US, for comparison, has a 65% <a href=\"https://www.census.gov/housing/hvs/files/currenthvspress.pdf\">homeownership</a> rate.</p><p>&#34;Over the past two or three decades, the price of Chinese real estate has gone up,&#34; Sun said. &#34;This has generated a popular belief in China that real estate is always safe to invest in.&#34;</p><h2>How much do homes in China cost relative to income?</h2><p>The average cost of a home varies vastly depending on the region and city.</p><p>In China&#39;s tier-one cities - like Beijing, Shanghai, and Shenzhen - housing costs around 14 times as much as the average salary, a 2020 report from the <a href=\"https://www.lincolninst.edu/publications/working-papers/housing-affordability-in-chinese-cities\">Lincoln Institute of Land Policy</a> found. In tier-two cities, homes cost roughly seven times the average salary, the report shows. And in tier three, four, and five cities, home prices are about five times as high as the average salary.</p><p>In some tier one cities, home prices per square meter are on par with what you would find in some of the world&#39;s most expensive cities, per a WSJ <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/reviews/out?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.wsj.com%2Farticles%2Fchina-property-real-estate-boom-covid-pandemic-bubble-11594908517\">report</a> that compared prices in China&#39;s Tianjin and London. </p><p><strong><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61541af0b414c1001862d9cd?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Aerial view of an Evergrande housing development in Wuhan, China\" height=\"1998\" width=\"2669\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>In 2015, Evergrande real estate acquired four super large projects in Haikou, Wuhan and Huizhou, with a total construction area of nearly 4 million square meters and a total amount of 13.5 billion yuan. Evergrande, China&#39;s largest property developer, is facing a liquidity crisis with total debts of around $300 billion. The problems faced by the company could impact China’s economy, and the global economy at large.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Getty Images / Stringer</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure></strong></p><h2>How much debt does an average borrower in China get exposed to in order to buy a home?</h2><p>Household exposure to debt is lower in China than in many other developed countries, but it still forms a significant part of their portfolio. </p><p>&#34;The debt level is lower in China than what you would see in other countries, for example, Thailand or Malaysia,&#34; Bernard Aw, an economist overseeing Asia Pacific for Coface, told Insider. &#34;Chinese citizens have high savings rates - about 40% of their money goes into savings.&#34;</p><p>They also tend to employ personal lending networks in order to purchase homes. At least 40% of China&#39;s millennial homeowners received money from their families to help pay for their houses, a <a href=\"https://www.hsbc.com/-/files/hsbc/media/media-release/2017/170227-hsbc-beyond-the-bricks-press-release-generation-buy.pdf\">2017 HSBC survey</a> on millennials found. </p><p>That said, the majority of debt in Chinese households is property-based, Aw said, and household debt has been on the rise since the financial crisis. In 2020, household debt rose to 128% of income, according to a <a href=\"https://rhg.com/research/china-household-debt/\">report</a> from China-focused researcher Rhodium Group. At the end of 2018, housing-related debt accounted for nearly two-thirds of the average household&#39;s total debt, according to a 2019 report from the International Monetary Fund.</p><p>Individual wealth in China is also heavily tied to real estate.</p><p>According to Moody&#39;s estimates, 70-80% of Chinese household assets are tied to real estate, <a href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/20/chinese-regulators-meet-with-developer-evergrande-as-scrutiny-on-real-estate-grows.html\">CNBC</a> reported in August.</p><p>That&#39;s more individual wealth tied to real estate than in just about any other developed country, Sun said: &#34;In the west, people diversify their investments and the majority goes to capital markets.&#34; But in China, where the capital markets are less developed and highly volatile, people keep much more of their money invested in real estate.</p><p>Household spending on real estate is also high, Aw said: &#34;Some 30-40% of household spending is going into the real estate sector, be that rental payment or mortgages, for example.&#34; This percentage is similar to how much Americans spend on <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/personal-finance/how-to-save-more-money-2017-8\">housing</a>. </p><h2>How is China planning to deal with its real estate debt?</h2><p>Beijing is already pressuring government-affiliated developers to buy up Evergrande&#39;s assets, <a href=\"https://www.reuters.com/world/china/china-asking-state-backed-firms-pick-up-evergrande-assets-sources-2021-09-28/\">Reuters</a> reported. On Wednesday, for example, it <a href=\"https://www1.hkexnews.hk/listedco/listconews/sehk/2021/0929/2021092900039.pdf\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"594dae649bbf96afa55584667649ffe0\">announced</a> it would sell off $1.5 billion of its stake in <a href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/profile/company/2066:HK\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"cde4c301c6841ee2569357d2f67f591d\">Shengjing Bank</a> to an investment company that manages <a href=\"http://www.sjfhg.com/p/introduce.html\" data-analytics-module=\"body_link\" data-analytics-post-depth=\"60\" data-uri=\"e20901118842b8685306b6587e05b455\">Chinese state assets</a>.</p><p>But when it comes to controlling the fallout around Evergrande&#39;s debts, both Sun and Aw said the government&#39;s first priority is the consumer.</p><p>The government &#34;is quite anxious about what this Evergrande crisis means for the average consumer or the homeowners,&#34; Aw said, particularly because so much of the average consumer&#39;s wealth is tied up in their real estate.</p><p>&#34;It&#39;s also why some of the measures taken by the government so far are geared towards helping the consumer first,&#34; he added.</p><p>&#34;The priority for the government in managing defaults or bankruptcies is to ensure social stability and negotiate a deal with creditors,&#34; Sun said. He outlined three levels of priority for the government: homebuyers first, creditors second, and existing shareholders last.</p><p>&#34;If you look at the collapse of major companies in China, that&#39;s always how the collapse is managed,&#34; Sun added.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/china-housing-market-explainer-cost-debt-wealth-evergrande-impact-2021-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a 2021 01:56:34 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/61541a1bb414c1001862d9c1?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"410d4afdd746532c82e29a647275661d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn24@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-29-982_625d49893b6b5476.webp","destWidth":2664,"destHeight":1998,"sourceBytes":1565148,"destBytes":1565148,"author":"insider@insider.com (Lina Batarags)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/6153c33ab414c1001862d843?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn60@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-30-509_d92b1e48e6281f3f.webp","https://i.insider.com/61541af0b414c1001862d9cd?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn8@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-31-499_164813662243ac8e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vq3yzQPda2w:2et_WgAAWoM:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn39@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-32-866_f7d1cd577afb2e09.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vq3yzQPda2w:2et_WgAAWoM:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn63@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-35-815_2d8cee24e5a6f542.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=vq3yzQPda2w:2et_WgAAWoM:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn40@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-34-407_d9bc147c611eba2d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/vq3yzQPda2w":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn63@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-34-178_4c72073367e1af0b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085616},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"Janet Yellen makes a historic declaration: She wants to get rid of the debt ceiling","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/janet-yellen-support-getting-rid-of-debt-ceiling-2021-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61560bff7b09e80018e59dab?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen\" height=\"1333\" width=\"1777\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen attends the House Financial Services Committee hearing in Washington on September 30, 2021.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Al Drago/Pool/Reuters</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said Thursday she would support ending the debt limit.</li>\n<li>Yellen recently said the government needs to raise the debt ceiling by October 18.</li>\n<li>The House passed a bill to suspend the debt ceiling but the Senate is likely to block it.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Amid the ongoing crisis around whether or not the US government will be able to pay its bills in three weeks, Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said that she would support getting rid of the debt ceiling.</p><p>Yellen was asked on Thursday before the House Financial Services Committee if she would support getting rid of the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/5-ways-the-debt-ceiling-battle-in-congress-could-end-2021-9\">debt ceiling</a>, which sets a hard cap on the amount of money the federal government is allowed to borrow. In short, she said yes, and called the law &#34;very destructive.&#34;</p><p>Yellen&#39;s answer pointed out the fundamental tension between Congress authorizing spending and then needing to separately authorize the borrowing needed to pay for that spending. </p><p>&#34;I believe when Congress legislates expenditures and puts in place tax policy that determines taxes, those are the crucial decisions Congress is making,&#34; Yellen said. &#34;And if to finance those spending and tax decisions it&#39;s necessary to issue additional debt, I believe it&#39;s very destructive to put the president and myself, the Treasury secretary, in a situation where we might be unable to pay the bills that result from those past decisions.&#34;</p><p>Other Treasury secretaries have also advocated for getting rid of the law. <a href=\"https://www.huffpost.com/entry/timothy-geithner-debt-ceiling_n_2147748\">Obama Treasury Secretary Tim Geithner said in 2012</a> - between the two Obama-era debt ceiling fights - that &#34;it would have been time a long time ago to eliminate it.&#34; In 2013, <a href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/wonk/wp/2013/01/23/want-to-abolish-the-debt-ceiling-join-the-club/\">The Washington Post assembed a long list of economic and policy luminaries</a> who favored abolishing the debt ceiling, including former Treasury Secretaries Robert Rubin, Larry Summers, and Paul O&#39;Neill.</p><p>Yellen said in a <a href=\"https://home.treasury.gov/system/files/136/Debt-Limit-Letter-to-Congress-20210928.pdf\">letter</a> on Tuesday that the government will run out of money by October 18 if the debt ceiling is not raised or suspended.  </p><p>&#34;At that point, we expect Treasury would be left with very limited resources that would be depleted quickly. It is uncertain whether we could continue to meet all the nation&#39;s commitments after that date,&#34; the letter said.</p><p>Yellen has previously expressed that not raising the limit could be a serious issue, threatening the US economy and the dollar&#39;s global standing. </p><p>&#34;I can&#39;t think of anything more harmful to the role of the dollar than failing to raise the debt ceiling,&#34; Yellen previously <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/debt-ceiling-congress-yellen-worst-outcome-dollar-default-recession-borrowing-2021-9\">said</a>.</p><p>The House passed a bill to suspend the debt ceiling and avert a government shutdown, but the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/mcconnell-senate-gop-national-debt-ceiling-default-government-shutdown-2021-9\">Senate</a> blocked it. A separate bill to raise the debt ceiling on its own passed the House Thursday, but that is likely to also be voted down when it reaches the Senate.</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/janet-yellen-support-getting-rid-of-debt-ceiling-2021-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=wc7RvLm0hNY:JV7NcAj2x7c:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/wc7RvLm0hNY\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Sep 2021 20:23:38 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/61560bff7b09e80018e59dab?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"222ab31aa176eb7a2952c79486f85f68","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn19@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-14-384_fdc0ce21801e5938.webp","destWidth":1777,"destHeight":1333,"sourceBytes":57694,"destBytes":57694,"author":"insider@insider.com (Madison Hoff)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/61560bff7b09e80018e59dab?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn19@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-14-384_fdc0ce21801e5938.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wc7RvLm0hNY:JV7NcAj2x7c:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn4@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-32-751_9de6fcf180519d5c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wc7RvLm0hNY:JV7NcAj2x7c:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn11@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-30-933_ac0b953489fdf6e9.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=wc7RvLm0hNY:JV7NcAj2x7c:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn15@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-31-482_e07f9bd0b179884e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/wc7RvLm0hNY":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn3@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-34-909_bca96187da6e5976.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085586},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"Amazon-backed Rivian beat Tesla to the market with its electric truck. We put it to the test in the Colorado mountains.","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/rivian-r1t-ev-electric-pickup-first-drive-impressions-photos-2021-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61521c582fb46b0019be4be4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[EMBARGO 9/28 DNP] Rivian R1T\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Rivian R1T.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tim Levin/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>I got to drive the Rivian R1T both on-road and off. </li>\n<li>It&#39;s the first modern electric pickup truck to hit the US market, beating even Tesla.</li>\n<li>Packing tons of cool features and exceptional capability, the R1T redefines what a pickup can be. </li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Ask someone what defines the quintessential American pickup truck and a handful of qualities may spring to mind: big, loud, unwieldy, and - if we&#39;re really committing to the stereotype - slurping gas as it belches clouds of black smoke. </p><p>The 2022 Rivian R1T is none of those things. </p><p>As the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/rivian-electric-pickup-truck-vehicle-ev-r1t-2021-9\">first fully electric pickup</a> to go on sale in the modern EV era, beating out Ford&#39;s familiar F-150 Lightning and Tesla&#39;s otherworldly Cybertruck, the R1T completely flips the script on what a pickup can be. And at a time when practically every car company is transitioning away from fossil fuels and battery-powered trucks are becoming the <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/electric-pickup-truck-comparison-tesla-cybertruck-rivian-r1t-2020-2#top-speed-tesla-cybertruck-4\">new rage</a>, Rivian has somehow beaten everyone else to the punch. </p><p>Not only is Rivian&#39;s truck the first of its kind - it&#39;s good. Really good.</p><p>I know this because Rivian invited me out to Colorado earlier in September to spend a few days getting to know the R1T inside and out. I scrambled up mountain passes, cruised sweeping highways, and got up close to the myriad of thoughtful features the truck has to offer. </p><p>More on all of that soon. But first, some background. </p><h2><strong>The 2022 Rivian R1T: A groundbreaking electric pickup</strong></h2><p>For the uninitiated, the R1T is the debut vehicle from Rivian, a California startup, <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-creating-fleet-of-electric-delivery-vehicles-rivian-2020-2\">backed by Amazon</a>, that&#39;s been working toward its first street-ready model since 2009. No US upstart since Tesla has succeeded in selling consumer electric vehicles at any sort of scale, making the R1T a big deal for Rivian and the global movement toward greener cars. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61521c56b414c10018629ac6?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[EMBARGO 9/28 DNP] Rivian R1T\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Rivian R1T.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tim Levin/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The R1T is medium-sized as far as pickups go. It&#39;s a little bigger than a Toyota Tacoma or Ford Ranger but a good deal smaller than full-size models like the Tundra or F-150. It&#39;s more luxe than any of those trucks, though, and carries a starting price of $67,500. </p><p>Those basic R1Ts will be available in January 2022. The first trucks getting shipped to customers this month are Launch Edition versions of the fancier Adventure trim, which starts at $73,000. Opt for accessories like a roof rack, a bed-mounted tent, a slide-out camping kitchen, and a swankier interior, and you&#39;re looking at a price tag closer to $100,000. </p><h2><strong>It crawls and cruises like a champ</strong></h2><p>The bulk of my experience in the R1T happened off-road, so let&#39;s start there. Rivian bills its vehicles as being for outdoorsy people who like skiing, camping, and the like, so the ability to confidently venture off the beaten path is central to Rivian&#39;s entire ethos. </p><p>Powered by four torquey motors - one driving each wheel - the R1T made light work of any obstacle and steep grade I threw at it during a day of off-roading (on trails Rivian hand-picked to showcase the model&#39;s strengths). The R1T promises to put out more than 800 horsepower and over 900 pound-feet of torque between the front and rear wheels.</p><p>But the truck offers a lot more than just four-wheel drive and a ton of power. </p><p>Since its motors operate independently, the R1T can instantly deliver more or less power to any wheel at any moment, a huge asset for tackling uneven terrain. Plus, you can toggle between drive modes that change the R1T&#39;s ride height, suspension settings, and throttle response for different types of off-roading. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61521c56b414c10018629ac4?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[EMBARGO 9/28 DNP] Rivian R1T\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Rivian R1T.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tim Levin/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The truck&#39;s air suspension allows for 14.9 inches of ground clearance in its highest setting, plenty enough to straddle sizable boulders without getting beached. Like many EVs, the R1T has a regenerative braking system that lets you speed up and slow down using just one pedal.</p><p>The instant you start letting off the accelerator, the motors start braking and feeding energy back to the battery pack. This is especially helpful for off-roading, which requires lots of careful stopping and starting. </p><p>All of this made the Rivian perform spectacularly well over all sorts of terrain, even in the hands of a novice off-roader like myself. All I had to do was select the suitable drive mode, keep steady pressure on the accelerator, and aim the truck at what I planned to go through or over. Simple as that. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61521c57b414c10018629ac9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[EMBARGO 9/28 DNP] Rivian R1T\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Rivian R1T.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tim Levin/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>Transitioning to paved roads was as easy as tapping into All-Purpose mode in the central touchscreen and airing up the tires using the R1T&#39;s onboard compressor. </p><p>On the highway, the R1T drives unlike any other pickup. First off, it&#39;s ridiculously quick for its size, especially in Sport mode. The R1T takes off from a stop with epic force, effortlessly makes passes at highway speeds, and always seems to have more power on tap. Rivian quotes a blistering 0-to-60-mph time of three seconds. </p><p>Carving around sharp bends, the R1T feels remarkably planted and doesn&#39;t experience any of the body roll you&#39;d expect from a high-riding truck. That&#39;s mainly thanks to the gigantic battery pack underneath its floor, which lowers the pickup&#39;s center of gravity and helps with handling while promising 314 miles of range for base models. </p><p>All in all, the R1T is so agile that it&#39;s easy to forget you&#39;re driving something bigger than an Escalade. </p><h2><strong>It&#39;s brimming with smart features</strong></h2><p>The R1T offers a dazzling variety of thoughtful touches that have nothing to do with how it drives. </p><p>There&#39;s a big front trunk under the hood and a cavernous Gear Tunnel that runs the width of the truck behind its rear seats. The 65-inch vestibule provides a ton of clever storage space and can be optioned with a $5,000 slide-out camping kitchen. Rivian says it&#39;s working on a bunch of other slide-out accessories, too. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61521c572fb46b0019be4bdc?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[EMBARGO 9/28 DNP] Rivian R1T\" height=\"1875\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The Rivian R1T&#39;s Gear Tunnel.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Tim Levin/Insider</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The Gear Guard system keeps an eye on the truck&#39;s surroundings using several external cameras and records when it thinks someone is messing with your truck or your stuff. There&#39;s an included cable for securing bikes and other gear in the bed. Plus, the truck includes a bluetooth speaker and an LED flashlight that both have their own little homes in the center console and door, respectively, where they&#39;re always charging. </p><p>The whole idea of a pickup is utility, and plenty of other trucks have that. But many of the features in the R1T can&#39;t be found anywhere else, partly because it&#39;s the first EV pickup on the American market and partly because to make a splash in a space with longtime heavyweights like Ford and General Motors, you have to go all-out. </p><p>And even though the R1T models are primarily aimed at sporty people, their utility can easily expand beyond camping and kayaking. </p><h2><strong>A great sign for our electric future</strong></h2><p>The 2022 Rivian R1T redefines what a truck can be. It offers a glimpse at the new-age features and capabilities coming our way as electricity sweeps the pickup segment and the auto market at large. </p><p>All Rivian has to do is build a ton of them, handle service and repairs, and not run out of money. As Tesla has demonstrated through its periods of production hell and its multiple brushes with financial calamity, that&#39;s no easy feat. </p><p>But for now, we know one thing: If there&#39;s an electric pickup that can unite buyers from across the spectrum - from truck fans, to early EV adopters, to nature-loving Subaru owners - the R1T could be it. </p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the Levin)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/61521c582fb46b0019be4be4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn39@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-32-565_92a0d373ee9a6123.webp","https://i.insider.com/61521c56b414c10018629ac6?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn80@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-34-362_f0d6c3c85580d117.webp","https://i.insider.com/61521c56b414c10018629ac4?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn27@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-35-901_8c950ef92159a9c4.webp","https://i.insider.com/61521c57b414c10018629ac9?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn15@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-35-248_ad710641b6da1b51.webp","https://i.insider.com/61521c572fb46b0019be4bdc?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn31@2020_2/2021/10/01/02-08-35-060_fedce412bfe9a067.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d_kd7GUGz-Q:IF-fBdTEsmQ:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn83@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-32-828_4b42384db83a6e46.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d_kd7GUGz-Q:IF-fBdTEsmQ:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn36@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-777_cb387f2bbc899f48.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=d_kd7GUGz-Q:IF-fBdTEsmQ:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn92@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-34-336_0913bed37914781c.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/d_kd7GUGz-Q":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn8@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-31-685_18bdb295962dfafc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085606},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"How to add checkboxes in Google Docs to create interactive to-do lists","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/google-docs-checkbox","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61563220b414c10018633c6b?format=jpeg\" alt=\"google docs\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Google Docs has a checkbox feature on its desktop site and mobile app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Shutterstock</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\">You can add checkboxes to Google Docs from the bulleted list dropdown menu in the toolbar.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">Checkboxes are interactive, which means you can click them to check the box and strikethrough the related text.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">The Google Docs mobile app for iOS and Android also has a checkbox option in the toolbar. </li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\"><strong>Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>The modern world is fueled by a never-ending array of tasks and to-do lists, and for good reason; there&#39;s nothing like a checkbox to help you (or others) stay on track. If you need to create a document with entries that can be &#34;checked off&#34; to indicate status or completion, Google Docs can help - it&#39;s easy to add checkboxes to any document, whether you&#39;re using Google Docs on a computer or mobile device.</p><h2>How to add a checkbox in Google Docs on a computer</h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Go to <a href=\"https://docs.google.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Google Docs</a> in a web browser and create a new document or open an existing one. </p><p><strong>2.</strong> Create the text that you want to add checkboxes to. For example, if you want to make a checklist, create a list of items on the page, and then select them.</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Find the <strong>Bulleted list</strong> button in the toolbar and click the dropdown menu. In the bulleted list options, choose the hollow squares, which is usually the top-right selection. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/615631b5b414c10018633c46?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[google-docs-checkbox1.png: / The bulleted list menu in Google Docs.]\" height=\"1505\" width=\"1895\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>You can find the checkbox option in the bulleted list dropdown.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p>The selected items should now be preceded by checkboxes. Anyone with permission to edit this document can click a checkbox which adds a checkmark and strikes through the accompanying text. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/615631e0b414c10018633c51?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[google-docs-checkbox2.png:/ Checkboxes in Google Docs.]\" height=\"1509\" width=\"1899\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The checkboxes in Google Docs are fully interactive.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2>How to add a checkbox in Google Docs on a mobile device</h2><p>You can add checkboxes in the Google Docs apps for <a href=\"https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.docs.editors.docs&hl=en_US&gl=USmp;gl=US\">Android</a> and <a href=\"https://apps.apple.com/us/app/google-docs-sync-edit-share/id842842640\">iOS</a> just as easily. </p><p><strong>1.</strong> Start the Google Docs app and open the document you want to create the checkboxes in. </p><p><strong>2.</strong> Enter the text that will appear in your list and then select it. To do that, tap and hold, then drag the selection bar to include all the text you want selected.</p><p><strong>3.</strong> Tap the <strong>Bulleted list</strong> button in the toolbar above the keyboard. The text will be bulleted, but the toolbar will expand to show the <strong>Checkbox </strong>button.</p><p><strong>4.</strong> In the toolbar, tap the <strong>Checkbox </strong>button, which displays as two checkmarks in a list. </p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6156325ab414c10018633c76?format=jpeg\" alt=\"[google-docs-checkbox3.png:  / The Google Docs app.]\" height=\"1344\" width=\"621\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Checkboxes are accessible from the toolbar in the Google Docs app.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dave Johnson</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\"><a data-type=\"60885ff47c964f47fe0aacf3\" data-title=\"How to insert a checkbox in Word that readers can print out or check off on their computer\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/insert-checkbox-in-word\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/6089c04341182b0019e80635\">How to insert a checkbox in in Google Docs to easily navigate to sections of a document</a></bi-shortcode><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a 2021 22:03:11 +0000","feedId":22,"bgimg":"https://i.insider.com/61563211b414c10018633c62?format=jpeg","linkMd5":"5f0d10f49deac542cb60d6a1c9caa5b9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn96@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-29-872_385f78d916fe885f.webp","destWidth":2103,"destHeight":1577,"sourceBytes":71862,"destBytes":71862,"author":"insider@insider.com (Dave Johnson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://i.insider.com/61563220b414c10018633c6b?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn60@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-35-418_82d8c7ed9eac94a9.webp","https://i.insider.com/615631b5b414c10018633c46?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn15@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-34-584_1391539c22383a14.webp","https://i.insider.com/615631e0b414c10018633c51?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn79@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-31-960_681426dcc4d38347.webp","https://i.insider.com/6156325ab414c10018633c76?format=jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn7@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-30-523_0ded785a104f7ccb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=yIl2AUoC8zA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn83@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-34-915_cc3ef43fc8ff5801.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mUOt10XHC4Y:4cNhP1lUfIY:F7zBnMyn0Lo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn60@2020_3/2021/10/01/02-08-31-515_42be86437fd666bb.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mUOt10XHC4Y:4cNhP1lUfIY:V_sGLiPBpWU":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn35@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-31-332_bd2b559c7174b995.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?d=qj6IDK7rITs":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn99@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-33-043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=mUOt10XHC4Y:4cNhP1lUfIY:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn99@2020_1/2021/10/01/02-08-35-484_78be590541da2c0b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/mUOt10XHC4Y":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn3@2020_4/2021/10/01/02-08-36-293_fcc0530f0a5146fb.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085759},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"How to access the hidden files on your Mac computer","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/show-hidden-files-mac","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/615624680037100018430048?format=jpeg\" alt=\"woman looking at laptop computer screen at home\" height=\"1249\" width=\"2500\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Accessing hidden files on your Mac may help you find lost files.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Maskot/Getty Images</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li aria-level=\"1\">You can show hidden files on your Mac by accessing the three libraries that your computer has.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">You can also use Finder or the Terminal app to find hidden files on a Mac.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\">Or, it&#39;s possible to use a third-party file manager to view all your Mac files in one place.</li>\n<li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/tech-reference\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\"><strong>Visit Insider&#39;s Tech Reference library for more stories</strong></a><strong>.</strong></li>\n</ul><p>Sometimes computers malfunction, and that can mean your files get moved to folders you&#39;ve never visited before. That&#39;s when looking in your hidden files can help.</p><p>On a Mac, there are many areas where a hidden file could appear. In fact, there are three separate libraries where you can look for hidden files. </p><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Note:</strong> Deleting hidden files isn&#39;t the best way to <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-free-up-space-on-mac\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">clear up space</a> because it can cause issues for your computer. </p></aside><p>Here&#39;s how to find the hidden files on your Mac.</p><h2><strong>How to show hidden files on Mac in Finder</strong></h2><p><strong>1.</strong> Click the <strong>Finder</strong> app in your bottom toolbar (it&#39;s the half-tone face icon). If you don&#39;t see your computer&#39;s name listed in the Finder sidebar, continue to the next step. Otherwise skip to step four.</p><p><strong>2.</strong> Click <strong>Finder</strong> in the top toolbar and select <strong>Preferences</strong>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61561f32003710001842fe68?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the Finder menu featuring Preferences.\" height=\"1038\" width=\"2136\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Go into your Finder&#39;s Preferences.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> In the pop-up window, select the <strong>Sidebar</strong> tab, then check the box next to your computer&#39;s name.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61561f7b003710001842fe7a?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the Finder Preferences menu on a Mac\" height=\"1728\" width=\"2000\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Tick the box next to your computer&#39;s name, under &#34;Locations.&#34;\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>4.</strong> Go into <strong>Finder</strong> and select your computer&#39;s name in the sidebar.</p><p><strong>5.</strong> Click <strong>Macintosh HD</strong>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61561fdb003710001842fe94?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the Mac folder in the Finder\" height=\"1284\" width=\"2176\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Select the &#34;Macintosh HD&#34; folder.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>6.</strong> Press <strong>Command + Shift + period key</strong>. Hidden files will then appear, and some, if not all, will be greyed out.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6156209ab414c100186336d1?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the hidden files in the Macintosh HD file on a Mac\" height=\"1208\" width=\"2160\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>The keyboard shortcut will expose your hidden files in that area of your computer.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>7.</strong> Repeat the keyboard shortcut to hide the files again.</p><aside class=\"quick-tip headline-regular\"><p><strong>Quick tip:</strong> You can also repeat the keyboard shortcut in other areas, like your documents or applications folder, to find moroe hidden files.</p></aside><h2><strong>How to show hidden files on Mac in Terminal</strong></h2><p>For those who aren&#39;t familiar with Terminal, it&#39;s basically a command-line system that allows you to take control over, and interact with, your operating system.</p><p>To the uninitiated, it might not be worth the effort. But if you&#39;re already familiar with the Mac Terminal, you may find that this process is a bit faster:</p><p><strong>1.</strong> Open the Terminal (if you haven&#39;t added it to your dock, you can find it by clicking the launchpad and searching for <strong>Terminal</strong>).</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6156211eb414c10018633704?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the Terminal as it appears when you search for it using the Launchpad\" height=\"1006\" width=\"1541\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Search for Terminal in your Launchpad.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>2.</strong> Paste in <strong>defaults write com.apple.Finder AppleShowAllFiles true</strong> and hit <strong>Return</strong>.</p><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/6156219bb414c10018633741?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the Terminal with the command to show hidden files pasted in\" height=\"1082\" width=\"1858\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Paste in the command on the Terminal.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><p><strong>3.</strong> Paste in, or type out, <strong>killall Finder</strong> and hit the return key again.</p><p>To make the files hidden again, change <strong>true</strong> to <strong>false</strong> in the original command.</p><h2><strong>How to find the Library folder and different types of libraries</strong></h2><p>Your Mac actually has three libraries, and each are accessed in different ways:</p><ul><li><strong>Library: </strong>This is found via <strong>Finder</strong>, and is accessed by completing the steps in the first section of this article.</li><li><strong>~/Library:</strong> Hidden in your home file, you can find this library by opening Finder, pressing <strong>Command + Shift + H</strong>, and then using the <strong>Command + Shift + period key</strong> shortcut.</li><li><strong>System Library: </strong>To access this library, you&#39;ll need to complete the steps to find the <strong>Library</strong>. From the <strong>Macintosh HD</strong> folder, double-click <strong>System</strong>. You&#39;ll see the system library folder inside.</li></ul><figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61562222b414c10018633798?format=jpeg\" alt=\"Screenshot of the Macintosh HD folder in the Finder on a Mac\" height=\"1171\" width=\"1678\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Open the System folder to view your system library.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Devon Delfino</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><h2><strong>Try using third-party file managers</strong></h2><p>A third-party file manager can provide a slightly more convenient way to view your hidden files alongside all your other data since it would all be visible on one interface. Some examples of file managers include:</p><ul><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://cocoatech.com/#/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Path Finder</a>: This features AirDrop and DropBox integration as well as a folder sync tool. It has a 30-day free trial, after which it costs $36.</li><li aria-level=\"1\"><a href=\"https://www.mucommander.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">muCommander</a>: You can use universal bookmarks with this manager, and customize the interface and set up keyboard shortcuts for easier use. It&#39;s available for free.</li></ul><bi-shortcode id=\"related-article-module-end-of-article\" class=\"mceNonEditable\"><a data-type=\"5cc1ecfeb14bf4615247f97d\" data-title=\"How to uninstall or delete apps on your Mac computer\" data-url=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-uninstall-apps-on-mac\" data-vertical=\"sai\" data-image=\"https://i.insider.com/60e4b7dd102fd50018477eed\">How to -043_740defb435ea442b.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=lsDCMUBYxew:nHjloEJC4mA:gIN9vFwOqvQ":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn8@2020_6/2021/10/01/02-08-30-687_c6d21d1910948c1e.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/lsDCMUBYxew":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn91@2020_5/2021/10/01/02-08-31-253_729c21e0bf92d5f4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1633054085723},{"createdTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","updatedTime":"2021-10-01 10:08:05","title":"Whole Foods founder John Mackey will step down as CEO","link":"https://www.businessinsider.com/whole-foods-co-founder-ceo-john-mackey-retired-2021-9","description":"<figure>\n\t<img src=\"https://i.insider.com/61560110b414c100186327a9?format=jpeg\" alt=\"whole foods john mackey\" height=\"646\" width=\"861\" charset=\"\">\n<figcaption>Jason Buechel is slated to take the helm at Whole Foods.\n<p class=\"copyright\">Dustin Finkelstein/Getty Images for SXSW</p>\n</figcaption>\n</figure><ul class=\"summary-list\">\n<li>Whole Foods founder John Mackey is stepping down as the chain&#39;s CEO.</li>\n<li>Mackey co-founded Whole Foods in 1980 in Austin, Texas. Amazon bought the company in 2017.</li>\n<li>Chief operating officer Jason Buechel will replace Mackey in September 2022.</li>\n<li id=\"recirc\"><a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/?hprecirc-bullet\">See more stories on Insider&#39;s business page</a>.</li>\n</ul><p>Whole Foods Market co-founder John Mackey announced that he will soon step down as the company&#39;s CEO. He will stay on until September 2022, at which point Chief Operating Officer Jason Buechel will take on the role of chief executive.</p><p>In a letter sent out to Whole Foods employees, Mackey wrote that he &#34;thought long and hard&#34; about the decision.</p><p>&#34;Honestly, it&#39;s very hard to retire from a company that I have helped to create, nourish and grow for 44 years when I leave.&#34; Mackey wrote. &#34;As a co-founder of Whole Foods, I&#39;ve often explained my relationship to the company with a parent-child metaphor. As a parent, I have always loved Whole Foods with all my heart.&#34;</p><p>&#34;All parents reach a time when they must let go and trust that the values imparted will live on within their children.  That time has nearly come for me and for Whole Foods,&#34; Mackey added.</p><p>Mackey co-founded Whole Foods Market in 1980 in Austin, Texas. Whole Foods expanded throughout the United States, often through acquiring other local and regional chains. The chain championed organic foods and products free of preservatives and artificial flavors and coloring. In 2017, Amazon <a href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/amazon-buys-whole-foods-changes-2017-8#:~:text=Amazon%20is%20officially%20buying%20Whole,that%20will%20change%20for%20customers&text=Amazon's%20%2413.7%20billion%20purchase%20of,with%20many%20changes%20for%20customers.stomers.\">acquired</a> the popular grocery chain for $13.7 billion.</p><p>The outgoing CEO said he will continue to visit stores and meet with employees before his departure.  Mackey wrote that he was proud of the company&#39;s role in helping &#34;tens of millions of people live healthier lives and it is not an exaggeration to say that Whole Foods has impacted very positively the way many people in America and around the world eat.&#34;</p><p>Mackey wrote that he was &#34;pleased&#34; that Amazon executives agreed with his top choice for a successor. Buechel joined Whole Foods in 2013 and became chief operating officer in 2019.</p><p>&#34;Not only is he extraordinarily intelligent with unusually high integrity, he is also a servant leader who lives and embodies Whole Foods Core Values and Leadership Principles and is fundamentally just a good and loving person,&#34; Mackey wrote.</p><p>Mackey also included a message for Whole Foods employees in his farewell letter.</p><p>&#34;Words cannot begin to express how deeply grateful I am for your partnership on this incredible journey and how much I love the company and all of you,&#34; he wrote. &#34;I may be retiring from Whole Foods a year from now, but so long as I am still alive, I will remain connected to Whole Foods and will do all that I possibly can to help us all continue to flourish.&#34;</p><div class=\"read-original\">Read the original article on <a href='https://www.businessinsider.com/whole-foods-co-founder-ceo-john-mackey-retired-2021-9'>Business Insider</a></div><div class=\"feedflare\">\n<a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=3bJlGoway5w:3eW8jJhKphs:yIl2AUoC8zA\"><img href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=3bJlGoway5w:3eW8jJhKphs:V_sGLiPBpWU\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3bJlGoway5w:3eW8jJhKphs:V_sGLiPBpWU\" border=\"0\"></img></a> <a href=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?a=3bJlGoway5w:3eW8jJhKphs:gIN9vFwOqvQ\"><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~ff/businessinsider?i=3bJlGoway5w:3eW8jJhKphs:gIN9vFwOqvQ\" border=\"0\"></img></a>\n</div><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/businessinsider/~4/3bJlGoway5w\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\" alt=\"\"/>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 30 Sep 2021 18:40:14
